Maridel owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Maridel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maridel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maridel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Preaek Andoung village in Kandal province is the location of this six member group loan. Mrs. N. S. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living conditions. 

She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She is also a fisherman. In the rice field, she has a problem because it is time for rice growing and she needs some money to support this. So, to improve production, Mrs. N. S. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed. She is a widow with two young children aged 1 and 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: María Isolina

texts.es:
María Isolina tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío Caracucho del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario entre abarrotes, productos de panllevar, bebidas, entre otros. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y también lo es para sus vecinos ya que la localidad en donde reside se encuentra muy alejada del pueblo central. María se esfuerza por brindar una buena atención y gracias a ello actualmente su clientela es permanente.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que su negocio pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Isolina is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the settlement of Caracucho, which belongs to the district of Mórrope. It is an agricultural zone with steady commercial activity located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a grocery store set up in her house and there, she sells different daily household items to her neighbors such as groceries, basic items, drinks, etc. The business is of great help for her family’s finances, as well as for her neighbors since the area where they live is very far from the central town. María works hard to provide good service and thanks to that, her customer base is currently permanent.

María wants to expand her business with the purchase of more products so that her business can meet the current demand. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase products to expand the grocery store in her house

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea H. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Simut Uon, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. 

They have been selling fish since 2005. They hope to expand their business and to buy vegetables and meat for resale so that they will be able to generate a higher income. Hence, Sophea is asking for his second loan of $400 to provide capital.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K. is a 20-year-old man. He earns his living by selling Khmer noodles. For additional income, he is a motor taxi driver (Tok Tok) in and around Phnom Penh City. He currently lives with his elderly mother who is a housewife. Sok K. typically generates an income of approximately $6 per day to support his family's daily expenses. Recently, his existing motorbike broke while driving and it is now an obstacle for him to run his business. Because of that, Sok K. has decided to seek a loan of $600 from Kiva, which he will use to change the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To change the broken motorcycle

loans.name: Vorng's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who are living in Preaek Kong Reach village, Kandal province. Each member's portion of the loan will be used for different purposes, but all look to improve their family living. 

Ms. Vorng S. is the group leader who was selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She needs some money now because it is time for growing rice. So to improve production, Ms. Vorng S. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and hire farming laborers and oxen to plow her field. She is a single woman who is living with two members in her household.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: South

texts.en:
Mrs. South S. is a villager who lives in Phum Thum, Kandal province. She is a 40-year-old widow with two children who attend the local school. 

Mrs. South S. earns her living through selling fruit in the local market. Even with this business, she earns little income to support her family. In order to increase income to support and improve her family's condition, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to sell. She hopes that her family will improve with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Punto Nueve del distrito de Mochumí, una zona netamente agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de media hora  de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de diversos productos en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de uso diario y abarrotes. Ella trata de brindar a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y un trato amable, gracias a sus esfuerzos la acogida de su negocio por parte de su clientela es permanente.

Gregoria desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 52 years old, single, and lives with her family in the settlement of Punto Nueve, part of the district of Mochumí. It is a mainly agricultural zone located in the province of Lambayeque, more than a half-hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She works selling various products in a grocery store set up in her house and there, she sells different daily items and groceries. She tries to provide her customers with good quality products and friendly service. Thanks to her efforts, the reception of her business by her customer base is permanent.

Gregoria wants to expand her business with the purchase of more products so that she can meet the current demand. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To expand her business with the purchase of more products

loans.name: Mr. Mao Den Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Mao D. is the president of a village bank loan located in Anlong Romiet Khang Cheung village in Kandal province.  He has been selected by the eighteen people who are seeking this village loan to improve their family living.  The members will use their portion of the loan for their own needs. 

Mr. Mao D. is a village chief who receives a low salary to support his family.   His wife is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family.  Mr. Mao D. has a problem because he wants to buy rice for food for his family, but does not have enough money.  He is applying for a loan to buy rice to feed his family. He is a father of two children, one is employed in a garment factory, and the other is a farm laborer and construction worker.

loans.use: To buy rice to feed family

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 48-year-old Kim T.'s daily routine. Kim T. provides her service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional and modern clothes. She runs her business very well, and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. 

Kim T. is married to Song Sing, 53, a construction foreman, and they have four children. One of their daughters is employed in a garment factory as an internal staff, while the other three are single and are studying in school. 

Kim T. is concerned that her daughter is facing difficulties travelling to her workplace. She travels to work by hiring a taxi or by walking because she doesn't have her own vehicle. To encourage her daughter, Kim T. has requested a loan in the amount of $1100 to to buy a new motorcycle for her daughter to travel to work.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle to travel to work

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna M. and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Khiev, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1993 and have three children – one son and two daughters. 

Mrs. Vanna M. is a flowers farmer.  She grows jasmine flowers and also buys other flowers from fellow villagers to resell in Phnom Penh market.   Her husband has been a construction worker for eighteen years, working in the village.

Vanna had previously asked for a Kiva loan to purchase jasmine flowers on contract. She needed to pay money to the farmers before the harvest season. Unfortunately, her mother died and she had to use a part of her loan for the funeral.

She now wants to expand her business by purchasing fruits (longans and bananas) for resale. Hence she is asking for another loan of $1,200 for this  purpose.

loans.use: To purchase fruits (longan and banana) for resale

loans.name: Srien's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who live in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province.  The group leader is Mrs. Srien R., a 27-year-old married woman. The members of this group hope to increase their income and improve their family's living with this loan. 

Mrs. Srien R. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells groceries and breeds pigs to support her family. She does not have enough money to support her pig breeding business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. 

Her husband, Mr. Mark Leang Hay, is a laborer who also supports his wife businesses.   This couple has three children: one is attending the local school, while the other two are still too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
Four people in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province are forming this group loan.  They have selected Mrs. Keo L., a 38-year-old married woman, to be the group leader. The members of this group hope to increase their income and improve their family living with these loans.

Mrs. Keo L. is a stay-at-home mother taking care of her two children:  one is a student and the other stays at home.  Due to her child's need to study extra classes, she is not able to pay for her child's school fees. So she decided to ask for a loan to pay the school fees. Her husband, Mr. Sin Mang, is 37 years old and works as electrician where he earns a little income to support his family.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou S., 49, is a widow with one son and one daughter.  Her son has full-time employment and her daughter is in grade 9. They are living in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chanthou has full-time employment with an NGO in Phnom Penh. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to improve her house by laying bricks and plastering the walls in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: To improve home

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 39 años D. edad, es casado y resiD. junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Sialupe Baca, una zona agrícoL. D. pobladores humildes y bastante trabajadores que se encuentra situada en el distrito D. Lambayeque, a más D. veinte minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica atrabajar en labores asociadas a L. agricultura, especialmente a las relacionadas con crianza y venta D. animales menores, el cría ovejas en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar L. zona en donD. vive. El negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos para L. economía D. su familia. Adicionalmente se encarga D. trabajar como jornalero en los campos D. cultivo D. L. zona.

Ismael desea adquirir alimento balanceado para poder hacer que sus ovejas se desarrollen favorablemente y puedan ser vendidas a un mejor precio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Ismael is 39 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in Sialupe Baca, a rural area with humble and hard-working people located in the district of Lambayeque, more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Peru. He makes a living working in agriculture, especially the raising and selling of small animals. He raises sheep in his home's backyard, and when they reach a good level of development he offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who often visit his area. The business is an important source of income for his family's finances. Additionally, he also works as a day laborer on the area's fields of crops. Ismael wants to acquire balanced feed so he can proviD. for his sheep's favorable development and sell them at a better price. To achieve this, he is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase feed to better raise sheep to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Nao Chantha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty-two people living in Preaek Svay village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nao C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living. 

Mrs. Nao C. is a Khmer noodle and congee seller in the local village.  With this business, she is able to earn some money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Oeun Uon, is a trailer and construction worker who also earns money to support his family. Her house is not comfortable to live in  because it is too old.  To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Nao C. is seeking a loan to rebuild her house. 

Mrs. Nao C. is a mother of five children, three are construction workers and the others are attending public school.

loans.use: To rebuild her house

loans.name: Prum's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is formed by four members living in Svay Pom Trang village in Kandal province. The group selected Mr. PrumV., 43 years old, as the group leader.  The members of this village loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mr. PrumV. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to cultivate bananas and papayas for a living. In order to grow this farm, Mr. PrumV. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. His wife, Mrs. Hor Kimsoeun, 56 years old, sells the fruits to support the family.  This couple has a child who is also a farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to cultivate bananas and papayas

loans.name: Morm

texts.en:
Morm S. is 46 years old and lives Phnom Penh City. She is a Khmer noodle seller.  This business provides her approximately $5 a day in revenue. She has a life partner in her husband, who works a policeman at the Ministry of Interior.  He has a formal salary every month and uses it to assist her in providing for the family’s needs. 

This couple has four children, who are all single and living with them under the same roof.  Her existing house is getting old and broken down, and is not comfortable for her and her family to live in. Morm S. wishes to fix it but her savings are insufficient to do so.  Morm S. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair house

loans.name: Domingo Demetrio

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe, una zona comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros). El brinda el servicio en la zona donde reside, sus hijos le ayudan eventualmente. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. Con estas actividades el ayuda a su familia a salir adelante.

Domingo desea brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que el contínuo uso otorgado ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar las reparaciones necesarias, así como adquirir algunos accesorios.
texts.en:
Domingo is 47 years old, married, and lives together with his wife and children in the district of Guadalupe, a commercial zone located in the province of Pacasmayo.  Pacasmayo is in the region of Libertad, more than an hour from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque.

He offers a transport service for cargo and passengers with his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transporting cargo or passengers).  He offers this service in the area where he lives, and eventually, his children will help him.  He also works in agriculture.  With these two jobs, he is helping his family to get ahead.

Domingo hopes to perform maintenance on his vehicle, as it has started to fail because he uses it continuously.  This is why he decided to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will make it possible for him to have the necessary repairs done, as well as to acquire some accessories for his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members living in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province. The group has selected Mr. Chin I., a 37-year-old married man, as the group leader. With the loans, they hope to increase their income and improve their family's living. 

Mr. Chin I. is a motorcycle taxi driver.  From this business, he earns a little income to support his family. Currently, his motorbike is broken and he doesn’t have enough money to repair I..  He is requesting a loan to repair his motorbike. He will use the remaider of the loan to pay for medicine. His wife, Mrs. Moeun Channa, is 30 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a little salary to support her family. 

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school and the other is just 3 years old.

loans.use: To repair motorbike

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Ten members living in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province are forming this village loan.  They have selected Mrs. Phon K., 55 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this village loan will use their portions of the loan to suppO. their different purposes.

Mrs. Phon K. and her husband, Mr. Yorn Syna, are farmers who own 3.50-hectares of land which they use to cultivate rice and corn for a living. They don't have enough money to grow their crops, so Mrs. Phon K. would like to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds and corn seeds to grow crops. 

This farming couple work very hard to suppO. their four children: two are laborers and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice seeds and corn seeds

loans.name: Mrs. Prak Da Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Preaek Svay village in Kandal province are forming this village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living.  Mrs. Prak D. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Socheat T., are farmers who rent a 1.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family.  He is also a farm laborer and fisherman. 

Now is the time to grow rice, but she does not have enough money to farm. To improve crop production, Mrs. Prak D. is seeking a loan to do farming this dry season. She is a mother of two children who are still too small to work or study.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Twelve members are forming this village bank loan.  They are located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. The members of this village loan selected Mrs. Sun K., a 37-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. The members hope to increase their income to improve their family by using these loans.  

Mrs. Sun K. and her husband, Mr. Chorn Khorn, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice and corn.  They face a problem in not having money to do this farming.  In order to grow rice and corn, Mrs. Sun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice and corn. 

This couple has five children:  four are students who also support their parents' farming, while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice and corn

loans.name: Naty

texts.en:
Mrs. Naty T. is 23 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Sokea Moeurn, is 25 years old.  They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have lived there since 2005 and have a 2-year-old son. 

Natyis a farmer.  She grows ginger on her farm in the village where she lives. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her ginger farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Sann's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people are forming this village bank loan. They are living in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. The members of this village loan selected Mrs. Sann S., 43 years old, as the village bank president.  The members will each use their portion of the loan for their different needs.

Mrs. Sann S. and her husband, Mr. Ing Sok, are farmers who own a 1.2-hectare piece of land which they use to cultivate rice and corn for a living. To support this farm, Mrs. Sann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn, rice seeds, and fertilizers. Aside from farming their own land, they also work as farm laborers to earn a little salary to support their family. 

This couple works hard to support their three children, who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice seeds, fertilizers

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun S. is 37 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Ay Norng, is 47 years old (pictured together).  They have been married since 1991 and have four children – three sons and one daughter, two have full-time employment and other two are in school. They are living living along National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Savoeun has been operating a laundry business at her home for three years. Her husband has been a construction worker for two years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to get to work

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao E. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Auk, live in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have three sons and one daughter – two are construction workers, one is a garment-factory worker,  and one is in school. 

Mr. Mao E. is a motorcycle taxi driver, a business he has been operating since 1989. His wife stays at home and does housework. He has successfully repaid previous Kiva loans. He is now requesting fourth loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for his son to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle for his son to go to school

loans.name: Suon's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven members living in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Suon Y., 48 years old, is the village bank president, having been selected by its members. They hope that the loans will help their families increase their incomes and improve their living.
 
Mrs. Suon Y. and her husband are farmers who own a 1.2-hectare  piece of land that they use to cultivate rice and other crops. They do not have enough money to support this farm, so Mrs. Suon Y. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow her crops. 

Aside from farming, her husband also earns his living through breeding ducks and selling their eggs to support the family. This couple has one child who is also a farmer and who supports his parents' farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to grow crops

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy O. (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Theun Sam, live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter, all of whom are in school. Vuthy is an English teacher. His wife is a tailor.

Vuthy wants a computer to make it easier for him to prepare documents and lessons to teach his students.  He also wants to change his motorbike to a newer model. Hence he is requesting a loan of $1,000 for both projects.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and replace motorbike

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Mrs. Tun B. (in the photo) is 39 years old.  Her husband, Mr. Phan Pheun, is 50 years old.  They have been married since 1989 and have one son, who is a security guard. The family lives in a small village along National Road number 5, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phan is a rice farmer and does construction work when he is not at the farm.  Tun sells Ansorm* in Phnom Penh market. She buys ingredients from the market and makes Ansorm by herself. She also assists her husband in the faming business when she is free. 

Tun is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to get work.  

* Ansorm is a kind of Cambodian cake made of rice paste wrapped in banana leaves.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to get work

loans.name: Mrs. Mak Sry Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 22 people who have selected Mrs. Mak S. to become the village bank president in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living conditions. 

Mrs. Mak S. is a farmer who owns a more than 2-hectare plot of land, where she grows crops to sell to support her famiL.. Besides farming, she is a pig-breeder and a knitter too. 

In the plantation field, it is time for growing, so she needs some money for support. To improve production, Mrs. Mak S. is seeking a loan to buy taro root for growing, and with the rest of the loan, she is going to buy gasoline. 

She is a widow with seV. children, three of whom are employed in garment factories while two are farmers and the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy taro root

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chan S. is a 31-year-old married man. He was selected as the village bank president by the fifteen members who are located in Krouch village, Kandal province. With the loans, they hope to increase their incomes to improve the living conditions of their families.
 
Mr. Chan S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates different vegetables for a living. He faces a problem in that he does not have a water pump to irrigate his crops. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase a pump. 

His wife, Mrs. In Sophy, 30 years old, works as seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary with which to support her family. 
This couple has two children: one is attending the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old and not yet of school age.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water crops

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal O. (shown in the photo) is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Bros Tuy, is 41 years old. They have been married since 1997 and have two children. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sophal is a lotus farmer and, when the harvest season comes, she takes them to Phnom Penh market to sell. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to transport her lotus to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport lotus to sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha R. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sea Chea, live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. 

Chantha and her husband raise ducks at home. They hope to supplement this with a new pig farming business. In this way, they will be able to earn extra income to support their family. Therefore, Chantha is asking for another loan of $800 for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Mrs. Sriv Sri Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sriv S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the twenT.-one members of a village bank loan located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to support her family.She is also a fish seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Sriv S. is therefore requesting a loan to buy more groceries to resell. She is a widow with one child who is a student.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: So's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen members form this village bank loan, located in Krouch village, Kandal province. Mrs. So S., a 41-year-old married woman, has been selected as the village bank president. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their families' living conditions.
 
Mrs. So S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She faces a problem in that her rice field does not have enough water to support it. So, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate her crop. As well as farming, she also breeds pigs and poultry. 

Her husband, Mr. Mang Vanna, 43 years old, works as house constructor and also helps on his wife's farm. They have five children; one is a farmer, the others are attending the local village school and also help in their mother's businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump

loans.name: Navuth

texts.en:
Mr. Navuth P., 43 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Leangky Mey, 42 years old, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have three children- two sons and one daughter.  

Navuth is a soldier. His wife is a chef and runs grocery store at home. He is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Saream

texts.en:
Mrs. Saream O., 25 years old, and her husband, Mr. Tina Vong, 30 years old, have been married since 2003 and have two sons. They live in a small village along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Saream O. and her husband sell mangoes. They buy mangoes under contract from fellow villagers and transport them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

The couple does not have enough capital to buy pesticide to protect the mangoes from insects. So Saream is asking for a loan of $600 for her capital.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes and buy pesticide to prevent insect damage

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Son S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Son S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She has some problems because her rice field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Son S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy fishing supplies because her husband, Mr. Tet Son, is a fisherman who is able to earn some money to support his family. Through this activity, they support four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, but the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Mrs. Saman C. (pictured above) is 33 years old and her husband, Mr. Savannara Duch, is 37 years old. They live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1993 and have five daughters. One is a garment factory worker, two attend school and the other two are still young.  

Saman sells meat balls in front of her house. Her husband is a construction worker. She hopes to expand her business, so she is applying for her first loan of $700.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam J. is 36 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia.  The family live in their own house on their own fenced lot.  Both of her two daughters attend a local school. 

Javzandulam and her husband operate a meat trading business in their town. They started this business in 1996 in Zanabazar market in their town.  Since 2007, they have been traveling to the countrysides to sell their meat. For delivery, they are using own car.  Javzandulam hopes to continue her success, and for the future wants to buy new car for her meat business. 

Javzandulam  is a responsible and hardworking woman. She needs more funds to buy a large amount of meat at whole sale price. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
Odsuren T. lives with her mother and sister in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her mother is retired and her sister helps in her consumer goods trading business. 

In 2008, she started her consumer goods trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. In 2009, she moved to the central market and bought her own stall. Over the years, she has gained much business experience and has built a positive reputation among her customers and suppliers. 

Odsuren graduated from a finance university, and in the future she is planning to work for a finance company. Also, she hopes to buy a car. She is an educated businesswoman.  

Odsuren is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more goods at wholesale price to increase the inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase goods at wholesale price

loans.name: Pagamtsogsmaa

texts.en:
Pagamtsogsmaa S. is 29 years old.  She lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in their own house and fenced lot in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  Her husband is a record clerk in the Governments Department and her daughter is in kindergarten.

Pagamtsogsmaa operates a small grocery trading business in her town. She started this business in 2007 by selling a variety of consumer goods out of a rented stall at the local trade center. She has found a success with her business in a short period f time, and since 2010 has opened her own grocery shop and hired one employee. 

In the future, Pagamtsogsmaa plans to expand her business by increasing her product line.  She wants to pay back her loan quickly.  She is a hardworking and modest woman. 

Pagamtsogsmaa  is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery products in order to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan S. is a silk weaver. She lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has three children – one son and two daughters. Her parents are farmers.  

Sophan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives and to provide her parents with capital for their farming business.

loans.use: To repair house and provide capital for parents' farm

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: Merilyn M. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Merilyn is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Merilyn runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling school products such as pencils, pens and notebooks. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Merilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sery

texts.en:
Sery (pictured) is single and lives with her widowed mother on an island of the Mekong River located 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. 

She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase weaving materials for continuing her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Producing Khmer noodles is part of 41-year-old Len S.’s daily routine. It is one snack food that is a necessary, vital product to people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she has been very widely known in this sector since before she was married. 

Her husband is skilled in making wooden furniture by hand in the village. Len S. is blessed with four children who live together in the family home. One of her daughters is married and currently lives in her new house. 

The core profit of Len S.’s house depends on her husband's jobs, and now he wants to add more capital as funds for expanding his business by purchasing some pieces of wood to make windows and doors for selling to people who need to repair and decorate their house. Because of this reason, Len S. has requested a loan to add to her personal money for her husband to buy some pieces of wood to make windows and doors for selling.

loans.use: To buy some pieces of wood to make windows and doors for selling

loans.name: Hundik

texts.en:
Hundik S. is 44 years old.  He lives with his wife and five children in a ger – a traditional nomadic tent, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia.  Two of his children are university students and three are attending a local high school. 

Hundek operates an iron work business in the town. He started his business in 2000 in the Tirlik market of town. He makes iron cookers, smoke holes,  and iron supplies for construction. He is a hardworking man.  In the future, he plans to expand his business by producing more variety of iron products and to sell during the upcoming big holidays. 

He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanjiku

texts.en:
For eight years, Elizabeth Wanjiku M. has been operating a salon and a beauty school with a monthly profit of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) in Kahawa Wendani, just a few kilometers from the city center.

She is 41 years old and married to Charles, who also gives good support to the family. Together, they have two school-going children.

Elizabeth learned about KADET LTD through a friend and she is applying for her first loan of Kshs 80,000 from KADET. She plans to add stock of beauty and hair products so that she can serve her customers well, and buy more water tanks to store water since there is always a water problem .

With the anticipated profit, she will plow it back into the business for it to grow, and eventually open another branch in town. She hopes to grow her business and in the future, buy a plot to build a house and settle with her family.

loans.use: To add more stock of beauty and hair products and buy water tanks for storing water

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie V. is from the village of Sinonoc in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Analie is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Analie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Analie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Analie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Analie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Sreyfas

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyfas H. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sles El, both 50 years old, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1978 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. Two have full-time employment and the other three are still in school.  

Sreyfas stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He produces hand rails and staircases made of cement. He wants to purchase additional materials to operate the business.

Sreyfas is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to provide capital for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband’s business of producing concrete staircases and hand rails.

loans.name: Analuz

texts.en:
Analuz M. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Analuz is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living she raises crops, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Analuz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sy K. (shown in the photo) is 53 years old and lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has six children: three sons and three daughters. 

Mrs. Sy K. and her husband are flower farmers. They grow their own flowers, and also buy some flowers from their fellow villagers, for resale in Phnom Penh market. The couple purchases flowers on contract, so they need to pay money to the farmers first, before the harvest season. They hope to expand their business by buying more flowers for resale. 
 
Sy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase flowers for resale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Elvira is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests flowers to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal N. (shown in the photo) is 36 years old. Her husband, Mr. Pich Keo, is 40 years old, and they live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1989 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. 

Sophal and her husband are flower farmers and also sell fruits (longan). [Longan, also called pitaya or pitahaya, tastes like pear, kiwi, and watermelon.] They buy longan from the fellow villages and transport it with flowers from their farm to sell in Phnom Penh market. They pay money to the farmers first before the harvest season. 

She wants to expand her business by purchasing additional longan for resale. So, she is asking for a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase fruits (longan) for resale.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en: Ulambayar Y. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter is a student in university and his younger daughter attends a local high school in the town. After working as a veterinarian in the Tugrug sum, an area of Uvurhangai, Ulambayar started his taxi business. For his business, he is using his own motorcycle. He is planning to buy a car for his taxi business because in the winter, it is difficult and dangerous to drive a motorcycle. Ulambayar says, "I'm working hard to provide (for) my family but also pay my daughter's tuition fees." He is requesting a 350,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to make a repair to his motorcycle and other remaining parts, and also to buy seeds of vegetables and poling for a fence.

loans.use: To make a repair to his motorcycle and other remaining parts

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline A. is a married woman of fifty years, her husband is called Nathan Ekesa and together they have three children.  They live in a roadblock area in Eldoret Town where she does her business of selling second hand clothes, she has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of four thousand shillings.

This will be Pauline's first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD, and she wants to use the entire loan to buy two bails of used clothes for resale. With the additional income she is going to get she plans to expand her business by renting a shop instead of selling in the open air. 

In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop where she can sell second hand clothes in bulk and therefore raise her family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy bails of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Yuos

texts.en:
Yuos T., age 55, cultivates a variety of crops on farmland that was inherited from her grandparents. She has financial support in her husband, who is a village advisor. 

For years, they have had a medium-sized house located in a rural area of Phnom Penh, where they live with their family. The couple has given birth to nine children, six of whom are now married, and the remaining three are unmarried. Yuos T. has made an income through her farming work in order to feed their children from the time they were young. At the beginning of the year, it is the good time for doing a dry season rice-field but Yuos T. doesn’t have capital yet for farming. Therefore, Yuos T. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanha M. is 21 years old and her husband, Mr. Siden Phout, is 27 years old, They were just married at the beginning of 2010, and she is pregnant. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Kanha and her husband sell Phaklov (a meal that is cooked with pork) in their village. She is asking for a loan of $600 to provide capital to purchase fruits (longan) for resale.

loans.use: To provide capital to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila L. is from the village of Katipunan,Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Cirila is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cirila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale. Cirila has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Cirila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cirila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cirila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase young goats, livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cirila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Sorth Chansok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorth C. is a village bank president who has been selected by 20 people who make up a village bank loan. Each loan member seeks to improve their family's standard of living with their portion of the loan located in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. 

She is a farmer who grows rice to support her family while her husband, Mr. Leas SoE., is a fisherman who is able to earn some money to support his family.

In the rice field, she has a problem because her field is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve her production, Mrs. Sorth C. is applying for a loan to buy a water machine. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer in Thailand while the other one is a farmer and the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine

loans.name: Margaret Jemutai

texts.en:
Margaret Jemutai R. is a woman of 35 years, married and a mother of four children, She has a shop where she sells goods such as soap, tea leaves, rice and salt. Margaret has been in this business for three years now and she gets a monthly income of 3,000 shillings.

This will be Margaret's third loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to add stock such as sugar, soap, tea leaves, rice, etc., in her shop,  With the income she will get, she will add more stock to her shop so that she can provide everything her customers ask for. 

In the future she hopes to educate her children to the highest level and also own a bigger shop.

loans.use: To add stock such as sugar, soap, tea leaves, rice, etc

loans.name: Sreyleang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyleang V., 19 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sophol Ut, 22, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and have no children yet. Sreyleang and her husband are garment factory workers. Presently, Sreyleang lives with her parents; she wants to build her own house to live in. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to use for the project.

loans.use: To build her own house

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S., 47, owns a health enterprise producing traditional medicines. She lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. To earn a daily income, Sen S. tries to find many kinds of tree roots from the nearby woods, then processes and combines them as sets of medicines which she sells to patients who are her neighbors. She has a partner in her husband, Yosas, 29, a garment worker. The couple is blessed with a young child who attends school and depends on their incomes. Lately, Sen S.' motorbike has been breaking down while being driven. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one

loans.name: Kundy

texts.en:
Mr. Kundy H. and his wife, Mrs. Sreytouch Vuth, live on the island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2007 and have two sons. 

Kundy is a motorbike repairman and a blacksmith. He operates his business at home. His wife is a weaver. He is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase spare motorbike parts to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorbike parts to expand his business.

loans.name: Mr. Heng Sambath Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who are living in Tnaot Nhi village in the Kandal province. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their famiL. living. Mr. Heng S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. He and his wife, Mrs. Sary Phou, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow taro root for sale to support their famiL.. 

But now his field is infertile and far away from the irrigation system, and he does not have enough money to address this problem. So to improve his production, Mr. Heng S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and he will save the rest of the loan to buy a water machine. He is the father of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase farm production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew his business tools and purchase paint for a new project

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Evelyn is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to buy additional capital for her business. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Thun's Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people make up this village bank loan. They are living in the Kandal Kraom village of the Kandal province. Mrs. Thun C. is 44 years old and she is the village bank president who has been selected by its members. The members of this village will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Thun C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farming, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for hiring a farming laborer to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Keo Kimsan, is a 39-year-old motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn some income to support their famiL.. The couple has four children, one of whom is married and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for hiring a farming laborer to cultivate rice

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 43-year-old Sen M.'s daily duty at a garment factory in Cambodia. Sen M. has been engaged in her job since 2002 and earns a fixed salary. She has a life partner in her husband who also works in the garment factory. The couple helps each other earn money to increase their standard of living to that of other familes in the Phnom Penh. 

Sen M. says that she has difficulty traveling to her work place. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi because they don't have their own vehicle. In order to solve this problem and cut costs, Sen M. is seeking a loan in the amount of $1000 to buy a used motor to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used motor to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Enhdolgor

texts.en:
Enhdolgor N. is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her son in Harhorin, Uvurhangai, Mongolia. They live in their own house with a fence. Her son is a 17-year-old student in a university. 

Enhdolgor began her cosmetics and accessories sales business in 2006 in the local market in a rented stall and has since built a stable and successful operation. She has been importing her goods from Ulaanbaatar, a capital of Mongolia.  

Enhdolgor  says, "I want to start saving money for my son's future education." 

She is requesting a  2,800,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to import more cosmetics items from Erlian, a border city of China.

loans.use: To import more cosmetics items from Erlian

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Regina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Regina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn S. is a 33-year-old married woman, and she is the village bank president, having been selected by its eighteen members. They are living in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal province. The members of this village bank hope that they will increase their income to support their families and improve their living conditions by using these loans.

Mrs. Horn S. is a farmer who owns a pL. of rice field which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She doesn’t have enough money to grow her rice, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay farm laborers to cultivate the rice. Her husband, Mr. Chin Channy, 31 years old, is a house builder and can earn a little income to help support his family. 

This couple has three children: Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is only 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay farm laborers

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon R., 28 years old has been earning daily income by selling a few products in front of her house. Chuon R. sells such products as sweets, sugar, cooking ingredient, fast food, and soft drink. She typically makes around US$3 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Chuon R. is married to 31-year-old, Nimol, who is a building worker. The couple is blessed with a young kid who is still not enrolled in school. In order to earn extR. profit and to make the business more successful, Chuon R. will be using the loan she requested to purchase some sugar, cooking ingredient and other essential item for selling.

loans.use: To purchase some sugar, cooking ingredient and other essential item for selling.

loans.name: Mrs. Tep Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people are made up a village bank loan in Sman Muni village, Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Tep T. to become a village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in which it can improve their family living. Mrs. Tep T. and her husband, Mr. Phal Chab, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. Now they have some problem because her field is ready to grow rice, but they do not have enough money. So to improve production, Mrs. Tep T. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are employed in garment factories while the one is a construction worker and the youngest one is two year-old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty-three members, they are located in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. This village selected, Mrs. Pok S., 40 years old, as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Pok S. is a farmer who rents some of her land to grow different vegetables for a living. She also earns her living by selling banana. Her husband, Mr. Dorn Narith, 41 years old, and he is a teacher. With their carrier, they still earn less income to support the family. In order to increase income to improve the family’s condition, Mrs. Pok S. wants to conduct a new business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fish for breeding. 

This couple has five children who are the students and who also help their mother's businesses.

loans.use: To buy fish for breeding.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina S. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Cristina is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cristina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure to expand her business.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Ka R. is an older woman of fifty-three years and the mother of three children; all of her children are married and have already started new homes. Ka R. sells dried fish that she buys in bulk on credit, which she also repays out of her income after she finishes selling the dried fish. Her husband always assists her in selling the fishes. They always used their old motorbike to pick up and for selling their product around the community every day. Unluckily, their old motor is broken and they often spent a lot of money to fix it so many times. For saving cash with repair costs, Ka R. has decided to borrow a loan from Kiva to buy a new motorbike for replacing the old one which is broken.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for replacing the old one which is broken.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled) transport services. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the third loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Mrs. Maen Mach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Maen M. is a village bank president who has been selected by fifteen people who make up a village bank located in Chumrov village, Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. 

Mrs. Maen M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice on to sell to support her family and she also weaves silk while her husband, Mr. Hi Kan, is a soldier who earns a low salary to support his family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So for this purpose, Mrs. Maen M. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is helping her to weave while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Maria is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling "balut" [fertilized duck or chicken eggs boiled and eaten in the shell] in the local community member. Maria is just starting this business.

In 2008, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah C. is twenty-nine years old, married to John Kipruto, and together they have three beautiful children. They live in strawberg in Eldoret Town where her shop is. She sells paraffin as a primary business and sells cereals at the same time. Both business are doing well. She has been in this business for seven years now and she gets a monthly income of six thousand Kenya shillings.


This will be Ednah's first loan from KADET LTD; she plans to add more stock in her shop, such as paraffin and cereals like maize, beans, rice etc. for resale. With the increased income she expects to have, she will add stock to her business and also pay school fees for her children.  Ednah hopes to educate her children and raise her family's standard of living in future.

loans.use: To buy more stock such as paraffin and cereals

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty-three members who are located in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. This village bank selected Mrs. Pen P., 39 years old and a married woman, as the village bank president. Each member of this village bank will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Pen P. is a farmer who rents 2 hectares of land which she uses to cultivate lotuses to sell to support the family. She would like to ask for a loan to buy lotus seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for cultivating lotuses. Her husband, Mr. Pum Ly, 48 years old, has a job as a construction worker where he can receive a little salary to support his family.

This couple has five children: Two of them are seamstresses in a garment factory and two are attending the local school while the youngest one is only 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy lotus seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to grow lotuses

loans.name: Marigold Group/rosalinda Lapinig

texts.en:
Rosalinda L. is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. Rosalinda is the group leader of a two-member loan group called “Marigold” offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, the group is collectively responsible for paying back the loans of fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Rosalinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Rosalinda joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan. Rosalina will use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
