Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally U. was selected as the village bank president of this village bank loan group made up of fourteen people who live in Chumrov village, Takeo province. Each group member will use his or her portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family’s living standards. 

Mrs. U. and her husband, Mr. Vet Phen, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land on which they grow rice to sell to support their family. They have four children, two of whom are weavers while the others attend public school. Mrs. U. also weaves silk. Her business is going well and she wants to expand. She is therefore asking for a loan to buy more silk.

loans.use: to buy silk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 43 years old and married to Joseph Mwangi. They have two children. For the last 20 years, Lydia has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. 

Lydia was introduced to KADET by a friend. This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she will use it to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer. In the future, Lydia hopes to start large-scale poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S. is a 58-year-old clothing vendor residing in Phnom Penh City. She currently sells clothing for both men and women in her community, and this business provides her with an income of approximately $2 a day. She is married with a son who is a fisherman. Pen S. is an energetic woman who never wastes time as she works to earn money to support her family. She has managed her investments carefully and has attracted a large number of clients due to her communication skills. In order to better meet her customers' demands, she would like a loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Girlisa's Group

texts.en:
Girlisa J. is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Girlisa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marigold 3.

Girlisa is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Girlisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Girlisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Girlisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maribeth's Group

texts.en:
Maribeth C. is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Maribeth is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marigold 2.

Maribeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Maribeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Maribeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Mrs. Nhae Srey Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhae S. P. is the village bank president selected by the members of this 9-person village bank loan in Chumrov village, Takeo province. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's lives. 

Mrs. Nhae S. P. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She also weaves silk. Since her weaving business is going well, she wants to expand. Therefore, Mrs. Nhae S. P. is requesting a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Bun Thoeurn Ngan, is a mechanic who earns an income to support his family. The couple provides for a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more silk

loans.name: Rosalia's Group

texts.en:
Rosalia M. is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Rosalia is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marigold 1.

Rosalia is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rosalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: Neak S., age 41, sells both used and new clothes in and around the city of Phnom Penh. From that she is able to earn $4 a day to support her family. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband divorced her when her two children were very small. Now her children are grown and can support the family by working in factory as a worker. Recently, Neak S. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Frecia Wangui

texts.en:
Frecia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 33 years old, married to Stephen Ngotho and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She serviced all her previous loans well and time.  She plans to plant potaoes in her farm and pay for labour.

In future, Frecia hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To plant potatoes in her farm and pay for labour.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ.. She is 40 years old. Alma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Alma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years.  She is 36 years old, married to Peter Njenga and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be her second loan.  She cleared her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In future, Eunice hopes to use technology to increase her farm outputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Mrs. Sot S. is living in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province and she is 66-year-old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family and she breeds some chickens at her home. She is a widow with four children, three of whom are employed in garment factories but the other is a farmer. Although she tries to work hard, she can earn a little income. So to improve condition her family living, Mrs. Sot S. is asking for a loan to add more her saving to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business, and rest of the loan she is going to hire farming laborers and oxen to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy a cow, hire laborers, and oxen

loans.name: Rodello

texts.en:
Rodello E. is from the village of Solinog Calamba Mis. Occ. He is 30 years old. Rodello is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rodello owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sugar, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rodello has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rodello joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodello is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rodello from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Peter Kamau

texts.en:
Peter has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years.  He now wants to start dairy farming and he has approached KADET for the financeing to buy a milking cow.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.

In future, Peter hopes to have grown into dairy farming and become a leading dairy farmer in the area.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Samuel Kabutha

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last five years.  He is 26 years old, married to Ann Wanjiru and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 25,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Samuel hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Hin P., age 36, has three children, all of whom are still young. She was married for a year, but divorced her husband. Presently, Hin P. works as a sewing laborer in the garment industry and receives a formal salary to feed her children. In order to find more profit, Hin P. would like to borrow some fund from Kiva to share with her coworker for opening new business by selling cloth for both men and women in front of the garment factory. This is the reason that Hin P. is asking for a loan.

loans.use: To share with coworker for puchasing clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Mrs. Chey R. lives in Voat Svay village in Takeo province and she was born in 1958. She is a pig breeder and farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family and she owns an agriculture machine. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to meet this purpose, Mrs. Chey R. is seeking for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food, and rest of the loan she plans to hire farming laborers to harvest rice. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a student while the other one is employed in garment factory and the other is a pig breeder.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon K. is two years old married to Helima Kandie who is a house wife.  He has a daughter named Renee Kemboi who is two years old.

He practices horticulture and he has been in this business for two years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 12,000.  He is borrowing a loan of Kshs. 40,000, that he plans to to use the loan as follows: Kshs. 36,000 to buy pipes for irrigation, Kshs 4000 for labour.

He will use the anticipated profit to diversify his business into keeping poultry.  This is his third loan, and he paid his previous loan successfully. His dreams and hopes is to expand horticulture and to have dairy farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pipes for irrigation and labour for poultry keeping

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose O. is from the village of Dioyo Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. He is 59 years old. Jose is married. To make a living, Jose owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately  5,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jose from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide repair services

loans.name: James Mugenda

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 28 years old, married to Teresiah Wambui and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilzer and pesticides for his farm.

In future, James hopes to start a auto spares shop in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilzer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married man with a child. He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, but he has a dream to build his own house in the next five years. He is a motorcycle rider and has been in the transportation sector for three years. The business is still profitable despite the challenge of remitting the biggest percentage of his daily income to the owner of the motorcycle. John needs the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mrs. Soem T. is a villager in Slaeng village in Takeo province and she was born in 1972. She bought a sugar palm for selling in order to earn some profit to support her family and she is also a pig and chicken breeder while her husband, Mr. Moeun Van, is a farmer who owns small piece of land where he grows rice and vegetable to sell to support his family. In her plantation, she has some problems because her husband’s field is time to harvest rice. So to improve production, Mrs. Soem T. is seeking for a loan to hire farming laborers to harvest rice, and rest of the loan she is going to buy fishing supplies to start a new business. She is a mother of three children two of whom are students, but the other is 2-year-old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To hire farming laborers to harvest rice

loans.name: Adyanaran

texts.en: Mrs. Adyanaran is a 45 years old widow, lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The eldest daughter studies in local University and two other boys study in secondary school. She owns a small plot of land and wooden family house. She has been running a timber and wood product sales business on local wood market for 13 years. Before she used to run this business together with her husband and when he passed away she started to run it on her own.  She buys a timber from wholesalers and makes a plank using a saw machine. This time of the year price of timber materials goes down and it is time when they usually stock up timber materials and sells them in April when building season starts. The reason she is requesting a loan is she wants to stock up enough timber and wood materials and to resale it when building season starts in April.

loans.use: she wants to stock up enough timber and wood materials and to resale it when building season starts in April

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy S., 27 years old, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredient, sweets, soft drink, and meat for cooking. Thy S. retails her inventory to people who are passer-by and are also her neighbors living near her house. To be ensured the entire family has stability financial, her husband plants rice crop on his farmland which comes from his grandparent. This couple now lives with two children who are going to school. Thy S. is taking out her loan to increase her inventory and to buy a cow for her husband to use in farming business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and to buy a cow for her husband to use in farming business.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk L. is married with Mr. Moeun Porng located in Thmei village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her famiL. and she breeds two pigs at her home. Since her breeding pig is going well time to time, she wants to expand. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Uk L. is applying for a loan to buy more four piglets and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Moeun Porng, is a palm juice collector who is able to earn some money to support his famiL. and he is a construction worker. This couple supports five children, four of whom are attending in public school and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy more four piglets and pig food

loans.name: Joseph Muchai

texts.en:
Joseph, 33 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He wants to diversify his sources of income by entering the motorcycle transport business.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a motorbike.

In future, Joseph hopes to grow in the transport business and have his own taxi.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros T. was born in 1972 and is a marry woman. She and her family are living in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell in order to support her family while her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chhun, is a duck breeder who is able to earn some money from selling duck eggs at local market every day. So to increase her daily income, she wants to expand this business, but she has a little money. To improve this purpose, Mrs. Ros T. is applying for a loan to buy one ton of ducks, duck food, and vaccine duck. Through this activity, they support three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory, but the others are students.

loans.use: To buy one of ton of ducks, duck food, and vaccine duck

loans.name: Bean

texts.en: Bean Y. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Her husband could make a profit by selling firewood, and earning about $3 per day. The couple has three children, and all of them are single, still living under their controlling. Bean Y. has raised a lot of piglets and she always receives a good result from this business. In order to earn extra income, Bean Y. will be using the loan to buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Doeur

texts.en: Mrs. Doeur N., born in 1979, lives in Trapeang Khnaor village in Takeo province. She has three children, all enrolled in the local public school and helping with their parents’ businesses. She is a farmer and owns a very small piece of land to grow rice which she sells to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Pou San, is a palm juice collector, laborer and cow middleman who also earns income to support his family. Her husband now wants to purchase two cows, which are cheap, in order to resell for a high profit. For this purpose, Mrs. Doeur N. is seeking for a loan to add to their savings to buy two cows.

loans.use: To buy two cows for resale.

loans.name: Rose Jemeli

texts.en:
Rose Jemeli L., 39, is married to Julius L., a hotel manager in Nairobi, Kenya. Rose lives in Kipchamo, in the outskirts of Eldoret, with her six children. She is a dairy farmer and also sells cereal around her home area. She has been in this business for eleven years and earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Rose's fourth loan with KADET Ltd. With it, she wants to buy another cow, as well as more cereal for resale. She plans to use the money generated to raise her family's living standard.

In the future, Rose hopes to improve her dairy farming business by making sure the cows are well taken care of and to educate all of her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy a cow and cereal for resale.

loans.name: Not

texts.en: Mrs. Not K. is married to Mr. Yorn Yorng and they live in Thmei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice which she sells to support her family. She is also a pig breeder. Her husband is a palm juice collector who earns money from selling palm sugar at the local market. Her breeding is going well so she would like to expand. For this purpose, Mrs. Not K. is asking for a loan to buy five more piglets. The rest of the loan she plans to add to her savings to start a new business by buying a cow for breeding. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and two of whom are students.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets.

loans.name: Philis Wanjiru

texts.en:
Philis has practiced agricultural activity in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 34 and a single mother to five children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to start rearing poultry for sale and she will use the loan to build a house for keeping the poultry.

In the future, Philis hopes to grow her poultry keeping business and become a leading supplier of poultry in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To construct a house for poultry to start rearing poultry for resale.

loans.name: Tob

texts.en: Mrs. Tob N., born in 1954, lives in Slaeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow both rice and vegetables which she sells to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Roeun Van, is a construction worker, fisherman and owns a stereo hi-fi instrument which he hires out to villagers. In the plantation, she has had some problems because her rice field is ready to grow rice but she did not have enough money to support it. So, in order to improve production, Mrs. Tob N. is applying for a loan to do farming, hire farming laborers and buy fishing supplies. She has two children, one of whom is a driver while the other is a farmer. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To support her farming business.

loans.name: Julius Kimani

texts.en:
Julius is 32 years old and married to Jane Wangui. They have one child. For the last 12 years, Julius has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time.  Julius will use this loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Julius hopes to practice large-scale dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Daniel Mwangi

texts.en:
Daniel is 24 years old and married to Mary Waruguru. They have one child. For the past eight years, Daniel has been selling clothes and shoes in Ndunyu Njeru town. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time. Daniel will use this loan to buy more shoes to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and own a boutique in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann K. is a 27-year-old woman with three children. She is a local villager living in a medium-sized home with her family in Kompong Tom Province. Chann K. divorced her husband a few years ago. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops including rice and vegetables to sell. Her crops grow well almost every season. 

Chann K.’s greatest business difficulty is transporting her product to market as she must always spend money to hire a motor taxi. Therefore, to save money and decrease her traveling expenses, Chann K. is requesting a loan to buy a used motorbike to get her products to market.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Four members who are living in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo Province, comprise this group loan. Mrs. Kong P., the group leader, has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards.

She and her husband, Mr. Hin Horm, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land upon which they grow rice to sell to support their family; Kong also breeds pigs at her home. She has four children, three of whom are students while the other one wants to go to Thailand to find work. Because she does not have the money to support her child's trip, Kong is seeking a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To support her child's trip to Thailand to find a job

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im L., 30, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, where she earns a living raising pigs and farming her own land. She has been running this business since 2001, and it has provided her with income to attain her present standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband who is a firewood seller. This couple has four children, all single and living under her roof. The harvest season is coming but Im L. doesn’t harvested her mature rice yet. So Im L. will use her loan to hire laborers to harvest her rice crop.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest rice crop

loans.name: Mrs. Heng Navy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who live in Trapeang Kur village in Takeo province. Mrs. Heng N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living conditions. 

Heng N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow both vegetables and rice on to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. P. U., is a motorbike taxi driver. In her plantation, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Heng N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a beautician while another one is doing housework and the others are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Bachir

texts.en:
Bachir is a 27-year-old single man from Tayouneh, owner of a men's & women's clothing shop since 2006, with 12 years of experience in this field. Bachir’s products are of good quality, and most of his customers are his friends, neighbors and relatives. His customers like to visit his shop on a weekly basis, to find out if he has brought new styles. He always works on renewing his product line as well as slightly changing the decoration of his shop. 

Bachir is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new lines of clothing for the festive seasons because most of his customers ask for something different for such occasions. Bachir hopes to open more branches in nearby areas.

loans.use: To buy new styles for the festive seasons

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Lay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Dak Por village, Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Meas L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. 

Meas L. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family; she also raises a pig. She is a widow with a child who is a construction worker. A. present, she has a problem because her home does not have a kitchen. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Meas L. is applying for a loan to add to her saved money to build a new kitchen.

loans.use: To add to her saved money to build a new kitchen

loans.name: Peris Waringa

texts.en:
Peris Waringa N. is a single mother of three children, she lives in Kahoya in Eldoret Town. Peris sells second-hand clothes in Eldoret town and has been in this business for seven years now. She gets a monthly income of six thousand Kenyan Shillings. She was introduced to KADET by her friends who are also KADET customers.

This will be Peris's third loan from KADET Ltd. She has been repaying well all her other loans and wants to buy more used clothes for resale.  She will also use some of the money for personal use. In the future Peris hopes to grow her business and be able to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: buying second-hand clothes for resale; personal use

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul A. is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Rasul wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan. Rasul will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only seven per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle and fodder for them

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.en:
A. Gulsunoy is 55 years old. She is married and is a loving mother of four children. In order to support her family, Gulsunoy sells underwear for women and children. She has been in this business for five years already. Over these years she has gained experience in choosing goods of good quality that meet the requirements of clients with various levels of income. The business is very stable and allows Gulsunoy to improve her family's living standards. Today she requests $1500 USD in order to expand her inventory. Gulsunoy would like to thank everyone supporting her and to assure them that she’ll pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to expand inventory

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a 33 year old married mother of three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Mukaddas started her own business 6 years ago in order to support her family. All year she sells fruits that she buys from local farmers. Twice a week, Mukaddas travels over 20 km to sell her produce at attractive prices at the busy market. 

With the loan of $2300 US from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her goods and to buy more fruits for resale. Mukaddas strives to give her children a better life than they have, including supporting them through good education. Mukaddas is a well spoken, friendly business-woman who is worthy of the support of Kiva partners.

loans.use: Increasing the range of fruits for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more ink pens, footballs, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for six years, Abduvahob was born in 1975 in Gafurov, Tajikistan. He is married and is responsible for four people consisting of his wife and three children. Very dynamic, serious and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his herd and repair his enclosure, so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from within 20 km of his village. With this goal in mind, Abduvahob is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Samuel Maina

texts.en: Samuel, who is 38 years old, married to Mary Wangari and the father of two children, has been in the transportation business for the last three years.  He normally transports farm produce to and from the market for farmers. Introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, Samuel is requesting his first loan in order to repair his vehicle. In the future, he hopes to buy a new lorry which he feels will serve him better.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
T. Davron is 50 years old. He is married and has one child. Davron is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Davron is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 7,500 TJS in his business. In order to receive this amount, Davron has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Nasurullo

texts.en:
Nasurullo T., 43, is a an optimistic, hardworking married father of four children. In an agribusiness for more than 15 years, he works his land with love and dedication everyday so that it produces excellent crops. Nasurullo in fact draws from his strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. His loving family is also engaged in this business. Additionally, Nasrullo runs a public transportation business with his minivan as an extra source of income.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and timeconsuming job, Nasurullo hopes to gather a rich harvest, and for this purpose he is requesting a loan of 12000 Somoni. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the wellbeing of his family. Nasurullo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
For the past eleven years, Galina has sold women’s clothes. She is the married mother of one child. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. She is hardworking and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Galina has a strong business base. 

Currently, she is seeking a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Galina plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: To increase her working capital in order to further expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of quicker oats

loans.name: Jàppo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité Jàppo est créé le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village et nouent de très bonne relations amicales. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MAKA L.. 

Madame FATOU D. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, vêtue de boubou en thioup rose/noir est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. Elle a aussi la responsabilité d'un neveu de son défunt mari. 

Elle fait du petit commerce des produits locaux (bissap, niébé) et la transformation d'huile d'arachide. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroître ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale. Elle réinvesti une partie de ses bénéfices dans le renforcement de sa marchandise.
texts.en:
The Jàppo Solidarity Group was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 12 women, all native of the same village and forging very strong ties of friendship. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois Maka L..

Mrs Fatou D., standing far right in the photo and dressed in a pink/black hand-dyed boubou, chairs the group. She is 44, widowed and the mother of four children. She supports also a nephew of her late husband.

She earns an income from her small store selling local products (roselle, black-eyed peas) and from producing peanut oil.

She will use her new loan to expand her inventory and thus get a higher income, which she will use to provide for her family and reinvest any remaining amount in her business.

loans.use: To develop and promote her income generating activity

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda and her husband are both very responsible parents, and they work hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their child the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband; she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent financial needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures and she would like a loan in order to increase her capital by increasing production. Mavjuda and her family are waiting for your quick response.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand her business.

loans.name: Esinyen Lopulumoe

texts.en:
Esinyen Lopulumoe L. is a young man of 33 years, married to Anna Amana. Together they have three children. They live in Mnyaka in Eldoret Town where he operates two businesses: he repairs bicycles and sells charcoal, the latter which is managed by his wife, and hence adds income for the family. Esinyen's family gets a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings from both the businesses.


This will be Esinyen's second loan from KADET LTD. He wants to buy bicycle spare parts and also use some of the money to buy charcoal for resale. 

In the future, he plans to buy a plot and build his own house in future. He also plans to build rental houses to ensure a stable income and to expand his charcoal selling business. He hopes to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts and also charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more spare parts and petroleum products

loans.name: Rohatjon

texts.en:
Y. Rohatjon is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Rohatjon is a very hardworking and independent woman. In search of a way to support her husband, as his salary was not enough to cover the family expenses, she started selling eggs, rice and sugar ten years ago. She has been an active client of IMON for the past two years. She has shown herself to be a reliable and honest person. 

With the purpose of expanding the business, Rohatjon is requesting a loan of $1,000, which she will use to purchase merchandise so as to offer a wider selection to her customers and increase her income. Rohatjon sincerely thanks you for your support.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more goods for resale

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 26 years old, is a single young man who is very ambitious.  He supplies stationery and schoolbooks in the area of Oloitoktok. Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and has not borrowed from other sources before.

He has been running this business for two years and he is hopeful that as the New Year approaches, he will get some good sales as the schools resume for the first semester of the year. 

This is the first loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to use it to buy more of the recommended books and school stationery, so that he can supply to as many schools and institutions in the area.

loans.use: He plans to buy more books and stationery for schools

loans.name: Dalerjon

texts.en:
D. Dalerjon is 22 years old. He is a very diligent and hard-working guy. He provides taxi services with his car. For the last three years his  business had been the main income for his large family, allowing him to improve their living conditions. 

As with any business generating income, Dalerjon also requires some investments from time to time. Now his car needs some repairs, so Dalerjon requests 4,000 TJS for purchasing spare parts. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all who support him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sticks and mats

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité Jàppo est créé depuis 06 mois, le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont issues du même village et on mené des activité communes depuis 1982. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MAKA L.. 

Madame FAMA F. debout à droite de la photo emmitouflée d'écharpe blanche etr responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de son petit fils.    

Elle vend du niébé et de fleures d'oseilles séchées (bissap) Elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine.      

Son crédit lui permettra de de renforcer sa marchandise et d'acheter au moins un mouton pour l'embouche.

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne, de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels tout en soutenant son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The Deggo Solidarity Group was created half a year ago, on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 11 women, all native of the same village and having worked together since 1982. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois Maka L..

Mrs Fama F., standing at the right side of the photo and wrapped up in a white scarf, chairs the group. She is 54, married and the mother of three children. She supports also her grandson.

She sells black-eyed peas and dried sorrel flowers (bissap infusion). She also rears cattle.

She will use her loan to expand her inventory and buy at least one sheep to breed. Her objective is to save more money, pay for her personal needs and support her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy groceries (black-eyed peas and sorrel flowers) and a sheep

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité Jàppo est créé depuis 06 mois, le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elle ont formé leur groupe par des liens de parenté et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MAKA L.. 

Madame BASSINE T. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de niébé, de la transformation d'huile d'arachide et de l'embouche ovine. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle avant s'approvisionner en marchandise et acheter un mouton.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises et  renforcer ses épargnes. Elle soutien aussi son mari dans la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
The Dioubo Solidarity Group was created half a year ago, on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 12 women, all native of the same village. They have created the group because they are linked through strong ties of kinship and natural affinity. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois Maka L..

Mrs Bassine T., standing at the right side of the photo, chairs the group. She is 42, married and the mother of ten children.

She sells black-eyed peas, produces peanut oil and rears cattle.

She will use her new loan to expand her inventory and buy a sheep. Her objective is to expand her inventory and save more money. She also supports her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy a sheep, black-eyed peas and peanuts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph C. is 36 years old, married to Janet Chepkwon who is a farmer. They have one child who is three years old. Joseph runs a retail shop and he has been in this business for ten years. His monthly income is Kshs 5,500.

He is taking out a loan of Kshs.38,000 and he plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase sugar, flour, cooking fat, tea leaves and salt for his retail shop.

He will save the anticipated profit. This is his second loan and he repaid his previous loan successfully. His hope and dream is to have a big plot of land and a nice family.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying sugar, flour, cooking fat, tea leaves,and salt

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. This young man works as a secretary in a local architectural company. His work is very important because with its income, he is able to satisfy his needs and help his parents pay his university fees. In addition to his job, he is attending the university. As with the majority of Lebanese students, his story illustrates the day-to-day challenges involved in working at a business while at the same time pursuing an education. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his courses at the university. He is studying Banking and Finance and this is his third year. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a bank to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: to pay for his courses at the university

loans.name: God’S Help Group

texts.en:
Freeman B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God’s Help'.  He is 54 years old, married, and has six children who are between the ages of 31 and 18 years. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 6 years, he has been selling charcoal in Neezoe Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 32,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. He describes himself as a friendly man whose goal is to improve his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Famatta is inset at lower right because S. was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more 'lappa' (traditional dress for women)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of bath soap

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 40 year-old ambitious man, married with four children living in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His family's desire is to own a permanent house and also to educate his children up to university. He is a farmer and has owned a pharmacy shop for over ten years. This has helped him provide basics to the family and move closer to his dream of becoming a commercial farmer.

Godfrey intends to use the loan to grow tomatoes.

loans.use: To plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael G. is a 34-year-old lady, married to Harun Makokha who is a doctor; together they have two beautiful children. They live in Ngenyilel in Eldoret town, and her husband Harun helps in feeding, clothing and educating the children. He also provides shelter for them. 

Abigael manages a motorcycle transport business where she has hired someone to do the work. She  has been working in the motorcycle business for five years now and she gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.


With the loan she is going to get from KADET LTD she will start another business buying and selling used clothes. Abigael will use the income that she gets to expand the business by buying  more used clothes to sell. In future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop for clothes.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale as a second business

loans.name: Teresforo

texts.en: Teresforo is a 62 year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal Uganda, with an ambition of having a family estate. He is a farmer and has been in this practice for forty years now which has enabled him to pay school fees for his children as most of them are now graduates.  His business plan is to become a commercial farmer owning at least a hundred acres of tea plantation.  Teresforo needs the loan to plant tea.

loans.use: Planting tea

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 48 year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to sustain the family is vested in him with minimal contribution from the wife who is a business woman. 

He has a retail shop and has been in this business for 15 years and he still reaps tangible benefits. His challenges include bad debts and seasonal customers and his vision is to become a wholesale trader. Wilson needs the loan to buy sugar, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.ar:
اسعد  في عمر 32 سنة يعمل في تأجير الدراجات الهوائية له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى
تطوير نفسه وعمله وتكوين مستقبل جيد له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان له تأثير جيد على مستوى المعيشي
له وتجديد مصلحته يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة شراء دراجات هوائية قديمة وتصليحها حتى يستطيع بيعها
من جديد له طموح كبير بأن يصبح صاحب محل خاص له حيث يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله
texts.en: Asaad is 32 years old. He has been working in the bike rental business for 10 years. Asaad likes his work and wishes to secure himself a bright future. He always works on developing himself as well as his business. Asaad has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. His previous loan helped him improve his living standard and grow his business. He wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy, repair and resell old bikes. He wishes to fulfill his strong ambition: owning a shop so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase, repair, and resell old bikes

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a mother of five daughters and four sons. She has a farm where she raises goats and honeybees. Majeda started her business few years ago and took loans from FATEN to expand it

Majeda came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase another goat and honeycomb boxes in order to increase the number of goats and honey production.

Majeda is a committed borrower and a successful woman from Bethlehem.

Majeda appears in the picture here wearing a protection suit while taking care of her bees with one of the employees.

loans.use: To purchase a goat and honeycomb boxes

loans.name: Adel

texts.ar:
عادل في عمر 56 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل في النقل العام يحب عائلته ويسعى دائما الى دعم عائلته
ماديا ومعنويا فهو جدي في العمل نشيط ومثابر له في عمله اكثر من 10 سنوات له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة
كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته حيث ساهم في تحسين وضع عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة جديدة 
لكي يحسن من وضعه المادي حيث انه يجد صعوبة مادية في تطوير عمله
texts.en: Adel is a 56-year-old husband and father of five who always seeks to support his family financially and emotionally, and who in turn is greatly supported by them. For the past decade, Adel has been very actively and assiduously working as a taxi driver. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Adel now wanted to seek another loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase new taxi

loans.name: Jamal

texts.ar:
جمال في عمر 22 سنة يعمل في بيع الفحم والحطب له في عمله 5 سنوات جمال طموح جدا يحب عمله ويريد ان يتطور وان يزيد
من مدخوله لكن تنقصه المادة كان له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض بزيادة البضائع في المحل
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى فتح محل جديد للبيع بالجملة له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه حيث يتميز
بالقدة والنشاط وحسن المعاملة جمال شاب طموح يريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد له
texts.en: Jamal is a driven 22-year-old who wants to secure a future for himself. He has enjoyed five years working selling coal and firewood, his customers hailing from his neighborhood and general community. His work is consistently marked by energy and good customer service. His last loan from Al Majmoua helped him to procure several wares for his shop. He is now seeking another loan to open a new shop for wholesale retail.

loans.use: To purchase a new store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old single woman living with her parents and 3 siblings. She is from Lebanon. She contributes, together with her father and brothers, to meeting the family income goal. She worked in a clothing shop for more than 5 years and in 2008 she opened her own clothing store. She purchases her products from a local clothing center.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy clothes in various designs and models so she can offer her clients a wide choice which will expand her profitability.

loans.use: buy clothes in various designs and models

loans.name: Jane Wanja

texts.en:
Jane Wanja Waigwe has been operating a hardware shop at Githurai for six months now and the business is doing well with an income of Kshs 20,000 per month.

She is 34 years old, married to Elijah Kiiru, and they have two children. Jane has never borrowed from any other MFI. This is first loan from KADET LTD, and plans to purchase more stock like floor and wall tiles, sinks, and toilet taps.

Jane plans to use the anticipated profit to save and invest back into the business in order to grow. She hopes to build a home and give her children better education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the hardware shop, e.g. floor and wall tiles, sinks, and toilet taps

loans.name: Marouan

texts.ar:
مروان في عمر 47 سنة يعمل في موقف للسيارات متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب عائلته ويريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان
يدعم عائلته طموح مثابر ومحب للعمل ما يميزه هي المعاملة الجدية والصدق تاريخ مروان جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان
للقرض مع المجموعة الاثر الايجابي على عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارات للعمل عليها يطمح
بشراء بيت له ولعائلته وان يكون لديه مدخول صغير يستطيع ان يعيش من خلاله هو وعائلته براحة مادية
texts.en: Marouan is a 47-year-old husband and father of four who wants to secure a better income for his family. Marouan is very passionate and diligent in his work at the car garage. He stands out for his professionalism and integrity. His last loan from Al Majmoua had a very positive effect. Marouan is now seeking another loan to purchase multiple cars which he could work on. He hopes that, later on, this will enable him to purchase a home and provide his family with a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase cars to work on

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and has one child.

In 2008, H. decided to run his own business, so he opened an electronics and household appliance store. He provides his customers with a wide variety of products. He is becoming well known in the local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to redecorate his shop to attract more customers. He is planning to expand his business and be wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: Redecorate his shop

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.ar:
محمد عمره 43 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في النقل العام له في عمله حوالي 12 سنة يحب عمله ولكنه يلقى صعوبة
مادية لكثرة المصاريف يحب عائلته ويريد ان يكون لهم مستقبل جيد له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة تلقى دعم كبير من العائلة
عنده حب التطور والتجدد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة جديدة وتأجيرها لكي يستفيد منها
فهو بحاجة كبيرة الى المساعدة في زيادة المدخول
texts.en: Mhamad is a 43-year-old husband and father of three who is always looking to secure a future for his family and who in turn is greatly supported by them. For the past twelve years, Mhamad has been working as a taxi driver. He loves to always develop. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Mhamad is now asking for another loan to purchase a new taxi cab.

loans.use: To purchase new taxi

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes H. lives in Gyumri City, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities of Armenia that was affected by a devastating and destructive earthquake in 1987. The people of Gyumri have been largely affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive.

Hovhannes has extensive experience in trading in unmounted construction materials. He buys the small, old, dilapidated huts that were given to earthquake survivors as temporary housing after the earthquake. His customers are happy to sell those huts to him, following their move to a new apartment. 

Hovhannes has applied for the loan to be able to increase his working capital.

loans.use: increasing his working capital

loans.name: Waseem

texts.ar:
وسيم في عمر 23 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع البزورات والحلويات والبن له في عمله سنتين يتميز بالصدق والشفافية
والاحترام يحب عمله ويريد ان يزيد من مدخوله المادي وتحسين وضعه الاجتماعي فهو طموح يريد ان يتطور وان يستقل
في عمله بحيث يمتلك محل خاص له تاريخه الاقتراضي جيد وكان له اثر جيد على تحسين وضعه  يريد من خلال طلب قرض
من المجموعة الى زيادة بضائع المحل الحبوب والبزورات والحلويات له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Waseem (23 y.o.) has been working for the past two years in a spice/candy/coffee shop serving his friends and neighbors. He is very honest, straightforward, and respectful. He is driven to develop himself and eventually own his own store. Waseem’s last loan from al Majmoua had a very positive effect. Now, he would like to ask for another loan to purchase more spices, candies, and cereals.

loans.use: To purchase spices, candies, and cereals for shop

loans.name: Abed Elkathem

texts.en:
This borrower, Abed, is 54 years old. He is married and has 5 children.

In 1990, Abed started farming cows which is traditional in his family. He sell a wide variety of dairy products. He has an excellent reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2000 loan to build a fence for the cattle. He is working on developing his business and increasing his revenue.

loans.use: Build a fence for the cattle

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk K. lives in Gyumri City, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities of Armenia that was affected by a devastating and destructive earthquake in 1987. People of Gyumri have been greatly affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive.

Hayk is married with two children. Before moving from the dilapidated hut that was given to his family after the earthquake as temporary housing, he had a small grocery shop. Now he and his family have moved to a new apartment built for earthquake survivors on the city's outskirts. He has also moved his grocery shop to the newly-built apartment block, which is the only one in this area.

Hayk has applied for this loan to increase the shop's inventory.

loans.use: increasing shop's inventory

loans.name: George Mbirua

texts.en:
George Mbirua N., who is 28 years old and married to Esther, has been running an electronics shop and repair service in Dandora estate, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city center. This is a very highly populated area with both low and middle class residents who are his customers.

He has been in this business for three years and earns a profit of Kshs.10,000 per month. He has applied for a second loan of Kshs. 60,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to purchase more stock (e.g. electronic gadgets) for sale. 

With the income gained, he will invest back in his business. He desires to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stock, such as electronic gadgets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business and buy chicken to farm and sell

loans.name: Linda Lucia

texts.es:
Linda Lucia  F. Q. tiene 21 años y vive en unión libre. Ella vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Linda es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Linda se dedica a la siembra de cacao y yuca y ya tiene este negocio hace 3 años. Ella compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. Ella solicitó el crédito para ampliar las siembras de cacao y yuca. La temporada de invierno es una época más difícil para su negocio y gracias a este crédito ella podrá pasar este época con más seguridad. 

En el futuro le gustaría tener un buen negocio, una finca y un auto. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar indoor y bailar en las fiestas patronales.
texts.en:
Linda Lucia F. Q. is 21 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Linda is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) community bank.  This new community bank is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Linda is a famer who grows cacao and cassava.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  She buys and sells her products in Matilde Esther.  She is requesting this loan to expand her cacao and cassava crops.  The winter season is a difficult time for her business and this loan will allow her to get through this period with more security.  In the future, she would like to have a good business, a farm and a car.  In her spare time she likes playing indoor soccer and dancing in local fiestas.

loans.use: To expand her cacao and cassava crops

loans.name: Roxana Katherine

texts.es:
Roxana Katherine V. M. tiene 19 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Babahoyo en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Roxana Katherine es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Roxana Katherine se dedica a quehaceres domésticos. Ella solicita el crédito para su propio negocio. El crédito incrementaría sus ingresos. 

Para el futuro la meta de Roxana Katherine es aumentar su negocio y tener buenos ingresos para su familia. El mayor desafío para ella y su familia es no tener suficiente dinero. 

Los hobbies de Roxana Katherine son leer y disfrutar las fiestas de patronales de su cantón.
texts.en:
Roxana Katherine V. M. is 19 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Babahoyo canton, in Los Ríos province.

Roxana Katherine is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Roxana Katherine does household chores.  She is requesting this loan for her own business.  The loan will help to increase her income.  In the future, Roxana Katherine's goal is to increase her business and to have good income for her family.  The biggest challenge she and her family face is not having enough money.  Roxana Katherine's hobbies are reading and taking part in the local fiestas in her canton.

loans.use: Own business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the crops he grows and to grow them better

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower, Riyad, is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has 3 children.

In 2003, Riyad bought a big generator and he started providing his local community with electricity. Every month his customers pay him a fixed fee.  He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $1900 loan to build a room for the generator. He is planning to expand his business and increase his revenue.

loans.use: Build a room for the generator

loans.name: Greta

texts.es:
Greta M. tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 21 y 17 años. Ella vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Greta es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Greta cría chanchos y pollos y tiene este negocio desde hace 3 años. Ella solicita el crédito para ampliar el negocio. Ella compra sus productos en pronaca. Gracias al crédito ella podrá mejorar el servicio.

En el futuro ella quiere tener su propio negocio y poder manejar su propia cuenta. Los desafíos que ella enfrenta son problemas de salud y en temporada de invierno baja el comercio. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar y ver televisión. Le gusta también ir a las fiestas patronales el 8 de diciembre: Virgen de Magdalena.
texts.en:
Greta M. is 43 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 21 and 17.  She lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Greta is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Greta raises pigs and chickens.  She has been in her business for 3 years.  She is requesting this loan to expand her business.  She buys her products in Pronaca.  This loan will enable her to improve her service.

In the future, Greta would like to have her own business and be able to manage her own account.  The challenges that Greta faces are health problems and the fact that business slackens during the winter season.  In her spare time Greta likes to relax and watch television.  She also likes to attend the local patron saint fiesta on December 8th: The Virgin of Magdalena.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana Isabel V. A. tiene 24 años y vive con su esposo en el cantón de Babahoyo en la provincia de Los Ríos. Ella tiene dos hijos: Jostin Javier Vaicilla V. de 6 años y Edgar Daniel Vaicilla V. de 1 año.

Ana Isabel es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Ana Isabel se dedica a quehaceres domésticos. Ella solicita el crédito para poner su negocio propio. El préstamo ayuda a mejorar la situación económica de su familia. 

El sueño de Ana Isabel es aumentar su negocio para poder mejorar el estado económico de su familia y en especial sus hijos. El mayor desafío que ella y su familia enfrenta es la carencia del dinero.

En su tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar y hacer repostería.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel V. A. is 24 years old and lives with her husband in Babahoyo canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has two children: 6 year-old Jostin Javier Vaicilla V. and 1 year-old Edgar Daniel Vaicilla V.. 

Ana Isabel is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Ana Isabel does household chores.  She is requesting this loan to set up her own business.  The loan will help to improve her family's finances.  Ana Isabel's dream is to increase her business so that she can improve her family's economic situation and particularly that of her children.  The greatest challenge she and her family face is a lack of money.  In her spare time she likes going for walks and making confectionery.

loans.use: To set up her own business

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: ORLANDO DE JESUS V. P.


Orlando de Jesús después de muchos años de desempeñarse como vigilante en la ciudad de Cali, queda sin empleo y regresa a Medellín a donde su familia para empezar de cero.

Luego de varios meses Orlando no consigue donde emplearse y decide comprar una bolsa de azúcar, hielo y unos limones para hacer limonada y venderla en la ciclovía.

Pasaron los meses y actualmente Orlando diariamente no solo vende limonada sino también otros productos, es por esto que requiere de un crédito para mantener su negocio surtido y con variedad de productos para sus clientes, además sus ventas se incrementarían y le podría proporcionar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Small businessman: Orlando de Jesús Velásquez P.

After many years working as a security guard in the city of Cali, Orlando de Jesús was left without a job and returned to Medellín, where his family were, to start again from scratch.

After several months, Orlando hadn't managed to find a job and so decided to buy a bag of sugar, some ice and some lemons to make lemonade which he would sell on a cycle path.

The months have passed and now Orlando sells not only lemonade every day but also other products.  He needs a loan to keep his business stocked with a variety of products for his customers.  This will increase his sales and he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Johana Alexandra

texts.es:
Johana Alexandra A. Y. tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y tiene una hija de un año que se llama Norelys Anahi Acosta A.. Ella vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Johana Alexandra es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Johana Alexandra comenzó su comercio de venta de ropa desde hace 9 meses. Ella compra sus productos en la cuidad de Guayaquil. Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar la mercadería del negocio. Gracias a este crédito ella podrá abastecer con la mercadería.

Para el futuro ella espera tener su propia casa y su propio local para poner su negocio. El mayor desafío que ella enfrenta es cuando un cliente no cancele.
