La señora tiene un negocio de venta de pollo de engorde y fotografías, dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años, ella inicio como una forma de generar ingresos a su hogar y con el apoyo de su esposo. Poco a poco fue invirtiendo en ciertos productos hasta tener el capital que posee ahora. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos y también en compra de alimento para los mismos pues en esta temporada tiene cierta demanda.
texts.en:
Karla is 34 years old and has one child in her care.  Her business is selling broiler chickens and photographs.  She started this business 5 years ago as a way of making income for her household, with the support of her husband.  She gradually invested in certain products until she had the capital that she has now. 

Karla is currently requesting a loan to buy chickens and also chicken feed since there is a certain amount of demand during this season.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es:
Walberto es un padre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en un caserío del distrito de Lambayeque, un distrito bastante comercial que se encuentra situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de pobladores de la zona, se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la agricultura, el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar diversos granos como maíz. Adicionalmente cría y vende animales menores y trabaja eventualmente como jornalero en los campos de cultivo cercanos.

Walberto es una persona que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Todo el esfuerzo que el realiza en sus actividades es para mejorar poco a poco la calidad de vida de los suyos. Actualmente se encuentra realizando algunas mejoras en su vivienda y necesita comprar material adicional para lograr su objetivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Walberto is 40 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in a neighborhood in Lambayeque district, a rather commercial district located twenty minutes from Chiclayo city.

Like the majority of those living in this zone, since he was a young boy he has worked in agriculture-related jobs. He has a small piece of land he works where he plants a variety of grains such as corn. In addition he grows and sells small animals and works as a laborer in nearby fields.

Walberto is a person who always wants to give his family the best. All the effort he puts into his work is to improve, little by little, the quality of life of his loved ones. Today he wants to do some improvements to his home and he needs to buy additional material to achieve this goal, so he has approached Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 700 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Buy materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Asociacion Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento ASOCIACION EMPRENDEDORAS es un banco que ya está en su segundo ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 8 Integrantes 5 Mujeres y 3 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta ropas y otros, y la Sra. OLMEDYS es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene una hija y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos cosméticos de feria en feria o a pedido y con el préstamo comprara más mercadería en ropa de mujer y productos de belleza  y  así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y la Sra. YOVANA es la secretaria en el Banco y ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos  a facilidad y tiene dos hijos con el préstamo comprará más mercaderías para su negocio de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos y aumento de su capital de trabajo. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The ASOCIACION EMPRENDEDORAS community bank are in their second loan cycle.  The bank has 8 members: 5 women and 3 men.  The ladies are saleswomen.  They sell clothes and other products.

Olmedys is the bank's president.  She has one daughter and her business is selling clothes and cosmetics in different markets or to order.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise: women's clothes and beauty products, so that she can increase her working capital.

Yovana is the bank's secretary.  She sells electrical appliances on credit and has two children.  She will use her loan to buy more merchandise for her business, thereby improving her income and increasing her working capital.

All of the members of this group are responsible and hard-working people who are grateful to the institution for the support they have been offered.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: women's clothes and beauty products

loans.name: Dolores Isela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar  encontramos a la señora Dolores. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres  hijos de 20, 16 y 13 años que  estudian en universidad y  colegio. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Tiene un negocio de imprenta y copiadora en su casa, aprovecha que su casa está ubicada cerca de un colegio de la localidad, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6h30 hasta las 17 h00 y a veces cuando alguien necesita algo hasta mas tarde, tiene este negocio hace ya tres años y dice que en este corto tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
 
Este crédito es para comprar hojas, útiles escolares entre otras cosas. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco comunal y le gusta porque gracias al crédito recibido de la institución ha podido comprar ciertas cosas para su papelería como por ejemplo un crédito le ayudo a comprar la copiadora. Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio y prestar también servicio de internet.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Damas Positivas' (Positive Ladies) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet Dolores.  She is 41 years old, married and has three children aged 20, 16 and 13.  Her children are studying at university and high school.  Her husband is a professional driver.

Dolores has a printing and photocopying business in her home.  She takes advantage of the fact that her home is located near a school.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 6.30am to 5.00pm and sometimes, when somebody needs something, she works until later.  She has had this business for three years now and she says that over this short space of time her business has been growing gradually.

Dolores will use this loan to buy paper, school supplies and other products.  She has been a member of her community bank for 8 years and she likes it because the loans she has received from the institution have allowed her to buy certain things for her stationery store such as, for example, one loan with which she bought her photocopier.  Her dreams are to expand her business and also provide Internet services.

loans.use: To buy sheets of paper, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hijo de 6 años de edad y su madre, tienen casa propia ubicada en Alegría departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 32 años de edad, este negocio lo administra en el mercado municipal de Berlín, con un horario de 6:00am a 5:00pm, desde hace 5 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería faldas, blusas, camisas y pantalones, con la compra estará aumentando el inventario y crecerá su negocio, atenderá de una mejor manera  a los clientes y sus ganancias también serán mejores.

Su objetivo es mantenerse a largo plazo con el negocio, ser responsable y vigilar por el buen funcionamiento de este, para garantizar a su familia una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her 6 year-old son and her mother in their own home which is located in Alegría, in Usulután department.

Ana is 32 years old and her business is selling clothes.  She runs her business in Berlín town market.  She works from 6.00am to 5.00pm and has been in this business for 5 years.

Ana is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise: skirts, blouses, shirts and pants.  With this purchase she will be growing her business and will be able to better serve her customers.  Her profits will also improve.  Her goals are to remain in her business for the long term, to be responsible, to ensure her business runs smoothly and to guarantee a more stable life for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: skirts, blouses, shirts and pants

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 59 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en uno de los distritos que conforman el distrito de Pacora, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lamayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. Ella cría vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio, las alimenta de pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente comercializa la leche que producen entre sus vecinos. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimentos balanceado de modo que pueda mejorar la producción de sus animales y de esa manera percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternbativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila is a 59 year-old mother who lives with her family in one of the districts that make up Pacora district.  This is an agricultural area, located in Lambayeque province, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Lucila has been raising and selling cattle for four years.  She raises cows in an area behind her home.  She feeds them natural fodder and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who visit her area.  She also sells the milk that her cows produce to her neighbors.  Her business is an important source of income for her family.  For this reason, she always tries to maintain it in the best possible way.

Lucila would like to expand her business by purchasing balanced animal feed so that she can improve her animal production and, in this way, make better profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed so that she can improve her animal production and, in this way, make better profits

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 46-year-old married man living in Tayouneh with his wife and child. Bassam has owned a laundry shop since 1997, and has gained 16 years of experience. Unlike most dry cleaning shops in his area, Bassam provides special customer service, according to most of his customers, who are his neighbors, friends, relatives, employees and tourists. Bassam is requesting his fifth loan from Al Majmoua in order to perform necessary maintenance on his machines. Bassam’s previous loans were so positive and effective for his business that they helped improve his family’s social and financial situation. Bassam hopes to provide a secure and healthy living for his family and to start a new business selling clothes. He was a car dealer for a long time.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his machines

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, tiene 42 años D. vida, se dedica a una tienda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 8 años D. edad, tienen casa propia ubicada en Berlín departamento D. Usulután.
Este negocio lo inicio hace 4 años, por cuenta propia, no hay un horario fijo para atenderlo ya que lo ha instalado en su propia casa, lo que le permite atenderlo a toda hora.
Ella en esta ocasión está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, bebidas y otros productos, con el objetivo D. mantener al alcance D. los clientes todo lo relacionado a la cocina y al hogar, esta inversión permitirá que logre agradar a más personas y aumente su demanda. El sueño D. ella es ver  a sus hijos realizados y mejorar su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old and works at a store. She lives with her husband and two children who are 12 and 8 years old. They own their house and it is located in Berlín, part of the department of Usulután.

She began her business on her own four years ago. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule for attending to the store because she has it set up in her house, thus allowing her to work at any hour. At this time, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of oil, sugar, toilet paper, drinks and other products, with the goal of meeting the customers’ demand for kitchen and household items. This investment will allow her to please more people and increase their demand. Her dream is to see her children fulfilled and to improve her living condition.

loans.use: Purchase of oil, sugar, toilet paper, and drinks

loans.name: Fany Esther

texts.es:
Fany tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un niño de cinco años de edad, reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola de terrenos bastante fértiles y con presencia permanente de agua durante todo el año. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a trabajar vendiendo ceviche (plato típico del Perú preparado en base a pescado y jugo de limón), ella prepara este plato en su domicilio y lo ofrece en venta a los vecinos de la zona. Ella acompaña este plato con diversos aperitivos típicos del norte del país como papa rellena, torta de choclo o papa a la huancaína. Este negocio es de bastante ayuda para su sostenimiento personal y el de su menor hijo.

Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a que Fany prepara sus platos con muy buena sazón. Su demanda es estable y suele aumentar por temporada de verano, por ello desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos de modo que pueda ampliar su producción y sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fany is 25 years old.  She is a single mother and has a 5 year-old child.  She lives with her family in Oyotún district, an agricultural area of quite fertile land which has access to a permanent supply of water all year round.

For more than 5 years, Fany has been selling 'ceviche' (a traditional Peruvian dish made from fish and lemon juice).  She prepares this dish in her home and then offers it for sale to her neighbors.  She accompanies the dish with several traditional appetizers from the north of the country such as stuffed potato, 'torta de choclo' (a traditional dish based on ground corn) or Huancayo-style potatoes.  This business is a great help in supporting herself and her young child.

Fany's business is very popular because Fany makes very tasty food.  Her demand is stable and usually increases in the summer season.  She would like to expand her business, acquiring more supplies so that she can increase her production and her sales.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more supplies so that she can expand her production and sales of 'ceviche'

loans.name: María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, su mamá vive con ella en su casa. El marido es médico veterinario. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, pero ella también tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas de inicios de clases elabora y entrega uniformes a escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja con la ayuda de su mama todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, los productos de la tienda los recibe en su casa.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar hilos y otros materiales para la costura, así como también productos para surtir su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque siempre cumplen con lo que prometen. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The ladies of the Positive Women Community Bank meet every other week in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which for many years has been known as the city of Reales Tamarindos.

Here we find Mrs. María, who is 53 years old and involved with a man. Together they have three children who are grown and living independently. Her mother lives with her in their home. Her partner is a veterinarian. Many years ago she learned how to sew.

She has a small grocery store and also also has a small sewing shop. Many years ago she began sewing clothing, making all types of clothing based on specific orders from customers or during back-to-school season, making uniforms to sell to the local schools. She works with her mother's help from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm every day and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. The products for her store are delivered to her house.

She will use the loan to buy thread and other sewing supplies, and also to buy products to stock her store. She is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because they always fulfill their promises. She dreams of having her own home since her current house is her mother's.

loans.use: To buy thread, buttons, zippers, groceries

loans.name: María Paulina

texts.es:
María Paulina tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. tres años a la venta D. productos D. belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo D. clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos D. parte D. la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo María se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

María desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo D. cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin D. mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
María Paulina is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayaltí, an agricultural zone with a lot of commercial activity. They live an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than three years she has worked selling beauty products and cosmetics through a catalog. She depends on a group of customers who frequently buy her products. The more orders she fills, the more business points she earns from the beauty company and this leads to higher earnings. For this reason, María always works to get more customers.

María desires to have a stable capital to buy more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics so that her customers can quickly purchase what they need and not have to wait until the end of the month when she delivers their orders. This is why she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles that will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To stock more cosmetics so that her customers can quickly buy what they need.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood, fried pork skins, tomatoes, meat, and condiments

loans.name: Maria Erodita

texts.es:
María de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora que está separada de su esposo y tiene un hijo que estudia en una escuela particular. Trabaja en un grupo de lectores de un periódico en el área de ventas de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana en la pequeña papelería que tiene ubicada en su casa. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso trabaja en una papelería que con esfuerzo ha podido surtirla los fines de semana ya que de lunes a viernes es vendedora en un grupo de lectores. Una de sus amigas le ayuda atender la papelería de lunes a viernes. Vende cuadernos, plumas, papeles etc. 

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, plumas, papeles etc. Uno de sus objetivos es seguir trabajando para mejorar su vivienda que ahora es de caña.
texts.en: María, age 37, is a hard-working woman who is separated from her husband and has one child who studies in a private school. She works with a group of assistans for a newspaper from Mondays to Fridays, and on the weekends she works in the small stationery store that she has in her home. She lives in a periurban zone called Paraiso and works in a stationery store which she has worked hard to stock. She works there on the weekends as from Monday to Friday she sells with a group of assistants. One of her friends helps her to run the store from Monday to Friday. She sells notebooks, pens, papers, etc. In order to continue with her business she wants to use the loan to buy notebooks, pens, papers, etc. One of her goals is to continue working to improve her home, which is currently made of logs.

loans.use: stationery, notebooks

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, con su esposo y dos hijos de 24 y 23 años de edad, solo uno de sus hijos es independiente, ella tiene 49 años de edad y posee una tienda donde ofrece productos comestibles del uso domestico y también sorbetes, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con ingresos, atiende todos los días de la semana y cerca de ella no hay otro negocio.
Doña Vilma está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  mercadería americana, con esta inversión busca fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos, logrando mantenerles satisfechos.
Sueña con ser dueña de un minisúper y ser distribuidor de confitería, y de esta manera estabilizar los ingresos a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband and two children who are 24 and 23 years old. Only one of her children is independent. She is 49 years old and has a store where she sells daily household items and sorbets. This business grew out of the need to help her husband with the income. She attends to the store every day and there is no other business close to her.

Vilma is requesting a loan for the purchase of American merchandise. With this investment, she is looking to strengthen the business and offer a variety of products to her customers, thus keeping them satisfied.

She dreams of owning a mini-supermarket and distributing pastries, thus stabilizing her family income and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase American merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire some games systems and have maintenance work done on those he already owns

loans.name: Selis Jair

texts.es:
Selis tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El es un joven bastante trabajador y emprendedor, con mucho esfuerzo pudo instalar hace mas de dos años un pequeño puesto de venta de alimento balanceado para animales en el mercado de su localidad. El ha estado trabajando arduamente en este negocio y gracia a ello su clientela es estable como también lo son sus ganancias. 

Con las ganancias que ha obtenido de su anterior actividad Selis creyó conveniente incursionar en el negocio de venta de calzado para damas, ya que existen pocos establecimientos de ese tipo en la localidad. El negocio va muy bien y actualmente la demanda se está incrementando debido a la cercanía del verano. Selis desea adquirir más sandalias para ampliar su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda que se viene incrementando, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que contribuyan con el logro de su objetivo.

El ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad el pudo ampliar su negocio de venta de alimentos y gracias a esa ayuda este ha podido crecer y de igual manera pudo instalar su puesto de venta de zapatos. Selis se encuentra bastante contento y agradece a las personas que colaboraron con el a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Selis is 19, single and lives with his family in the Cayalti district, an agricultural zone with considerable commercial activity, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He is a very hard-working and enterprising youth. With a lot of hard work he was able to open a store for balanced animal food two years ago in the local market. He has worked hard in this business and thanks to his hard work his customer base and income are stable. With the earnings that he has obtained from this business, he decided to venture into selling women's shoes, as there are few such businesses in the area. The business is going very well and the demand is increasing due to the upcoming summer. Selis wants to acquire more sandals to expand his business and satisfy the increasing demand. In order to do so he has needed to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will contribute to the achievement of his goal. He has already had one loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and Capital Semilla. He was able to expand his food business, and thanks to this help his business grew and he was able to open his shoe sales business. Selis is very happy and thankful to the people who are working together through Kiva.

loans.use: To acquire more sandalls to expand his business and satisfy increasing demand

loans.name: Alonzo

texts.es:
Alonzo es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola de tierras bastante fértiles debido a que cuentan con agua durante todo el año. Se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años  a trabajar en la crianza y comercialización de cerdos. El cría sus animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y al público en general. El negocio es una fuente bastante importante de ingresos para sostener la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Alonzo desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para lograr que sus cerdos se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a un mejor precio, además desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alonzo is a 44-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún. It is an agricultural zone with very fertile lands due to the fact that they have water all year round, and it is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked for more than ten years raising and selling pigs. He raises his animals in the back part of his house, feeding them grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a good size, he sells them to the businessmen that visit the area where he lives and to the general public. The business is a very important source of income to support his family, which is why he always tries to maintain it in the best way possible.

Alonzo wants to get more balanced feed so that his pigs grow better and can be sold at a better price. He also wants to make some improvements on his pens. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To get more balanced feed so that his pigs will grow better and can be sold at a better price

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Enma O., pertenece a la alcancía comunal La Nueva esperanza conformada por siete integrantes, los cuales son todos vecinos ya que viven en el mismo barrio. Algo que las caracteriza es el esfuerzo que realizan diariamente por salir adelante y dar un mejora económica a sus hogares, muestra de ello es la señora Enma O. de 49 años de edad casada y madre de dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un pequeño puesto que pudo conseguir por medio de una amiga, hace ya más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones económicas a lo largo de tantos año, una de ella  es la educación de sus hijos y la implementación de mueble para su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería como son polos y pantalones.
texts.en:
Enma O. belongs to the “La Nueva Esperanza” Communal Bank.  It is comprised of seven members who are all neighbors.  They live in the same neighborhood.  One thing that distinguishes them is the effort they put forth daily to get ahead and improve their households’ finances.

Enma O., age 49, is an example of that.  She is married and has two adult children.  She sells clothes from a small stand that she was able to get through a friend.  She has been selling clothes for over 20 years.  Throughout these many years this business activity has given her a lot of financial satisfaction.  Some examples are educating her children and getting furniture for her home.

She plans to use this loan to buy merchandise like polo style shirts and pants.

loans.use: To buy polo style shirts and merchandise

loans.name: Sazana Genin

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Suzana, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 14, 13 y 12  años los mismos que estudian en Universidad y colegio. El marido es comerciante de ganado. Ella lleva en el Banco Comunal por 38 ciclos y le gusta todo del Banco por eso ha durado tanto tiempo.

Tiene una papelería y copiadora, pero además también tiene un pequeño comedor, en estos negocios trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00 en su comedor, pero al mismo tiempo atiende la papelería y en ella trabaja hasta las 20h00, no le preocupa el horario porque sus negocios los tiene en su casa y esto le gusta ya que además de trabajar también está al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos como hojas, útiles escolares y productos e ingredientes para preparar los alimentos. Sus sueños son aumentar más el negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Positivas” (Positive Women) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí.  It has been known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds for many years.

This is where we find Suzana, age 43.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has four children.  They are 19, 14, 13, and 12 years old.  They attend the university and high school.  Her husband deals in livestock.

She has been in the communal bank for 38 cycles.  She likes everything about the bank, and that is why she has been a member for so long.  She has a stationery and copy shop.  She also has a small dining room.  

She works in her dining room every day from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.   At the same time she takes care of the stationery store, and works there until 8:00 p.m.  The schedule does not concern her because her businesses are in her house.  She likes this because, in addition to working, she also keeps up with her children’s needs. 

She will use this loan to buy products like paper, school supplies, and products and ingredients to make food.

Her dream is to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy products like paper, school supplies, and products and ingredients to make food

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, el limón y la maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. El cría pavos y gallinas en unos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente se dedica a la siembra de limón en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para sostener los gastos económicos de su familia.

Braulio desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo alimento balanceado para lograr que sus aves de desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidas a un mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Braulio is 63 years old, married and lives with his family in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  This is an area with a semi-tropical climate whose main production is fruits such as mangoes, lemons and passion fruit.  It is located in Piura region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Braulio raises and sells poultry.  He raises turkeys and chickens in some pens located behind his home.  When the animals have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who visit his area.  He also grows lemons on a small plot of land that he owns.  He uses the profits he makes from his business to support his family financially.  Braulio would like to expand his business, acquiring balanced animal feed so that his birds develop in the best way possible and can be sold for the best price possible.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire balanced animal feed so that his birds develop in the best way possible and can be sold for the best price possible

loans.name: Brendy Marisol

texts.es:
Brendy tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a su madre y a su hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, el limón y la maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como vendedora en una tienda agrícola de la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente se dedica a la elaboración manual de manteles y muñecas. Ella confecciona sus productos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a las personas que le hace pedidos y también a los comerciantes del mercado de su localidad. Con estas actividades ella se encarga de sacar adelante a su hijo y colaborar con la economía de su familia.

La demanda por lo artículos que confecciona ha ido acrecentándose y por ello Brendy ha creído conveniente adquirir más material para ampliar su producción y satisfacer a sus clientes. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Brendy is a 41 year old single mother and lives with her mother and son in one of the towns that form the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a semitropical area that mainly produces fruits such as mango, lemon, and passion fruit. It is in the Piura region and located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works as a saleswoman in an agricultural store in her home area. She also works making table cloths and dolls. She makes her products in her home and sells them by special order and also to the salespeople at the local market. With these jobs she is working to to help her son get ahead and provide for her family.

The demand for her crafts has been increasing and Brendy feels it would be a good idea to buy more supplies to increase her production and satisfy more customers. To help her with this objective she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Supplies for her crafts business

loans.name: Silvana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquideas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Silvana, ella tiene 36 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad la cual estudia en colegio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Tiene una lavadora de carros en la Avenida del Ejército en la cual además de ofrecer este servicio también vende refrigerantes y líquidos de batería, además en las noches utiliza el lugar como garaje. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, con ella trabajan tres personas a quienes ella les paga un sueldo semanal.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar una máquina para limpiar y lavar alfombras. Sus metas son hacer su propia casa y tener su propio local, ya que donde vive y tiene su negocio es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Damas Positivas” (Positive Women) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí. It has been known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds for many years.

This is where we find Silvana, age 36.  She is divorced, and she has a 15 year old daughter who is in high school.  She has been in the communal bank for eight years, and she likes it because the loans are fast and do not have so many requirements.

She has a carwash on the Avenida del Ejército.  In addition to carwash services, she also sells antifreeze and brake fluid.  Also, in the evenings she uses the place as a garage.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She pays a weekly salary to the three people that work with her.

She will use the loan to buy a machine for cleaning and washing carpets.

Her goals are to have her own house and her own place.  She rents where she lives and the place where she has her business.

loans.use: To buy a machine to clean and wash carpets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jesús María

texts.es:
Jesús María tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que produce principalmente mango, limón y maracuyá, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra situada a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización D. bebidas en su domicilio. Ella comercializa gaseosas y cervezas entre los vecinos D. su localidad. Como el negocio ya cuenta con varios años D. funcionamiento y ella siempre se esfuerza por brindar productos D. buena calidad. La demanda con la que cuenta es bastante estable. Los ingresos que percibe D. estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Jesús desea adquirir más bebidas para satisfacer a sus clientes ya que durante la presente temporada D. verano la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jesús María is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area with a semi-tropical climate which mainly produces mangoes, lemons and passion fruit.  It is located in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Jesús sells drinks from her home.  She sells soda and beer to her neighbors.  As she has been running her business for several years and she always works hard to proviD. good-quality products, her customer demand is quite stable.  She uses the profits she makes from this activity to help her husband support their family financially.

Jesús would like to acquire more drinks to satisfy her customers since her demand usually rises during the summer season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more drinks to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es: Rosa C. pertenece a la alcancía comunal Ebenezer conformada hace mas de 4 años y medio y está integrada por 9 participantes, los cuales  son todos vecinos y radican en el distrito del Agustino, un grupo con características de éxito y perseverancia en el desempeño de sus negocios, muestra de ello es la señora Rosa C. de 37 años de edad con dos pequeños hijos a su cuidado. Ella diariamente se dedica a la fabricación de polos que realiza en su casa ya que fue ahí donde instalo un pequeño taller, posterior a eso luego de fabricarlos los vende a personas que ya le avían hecho pedidos con anticipación. Con el presente préstamo lo invertirá en compra de materiales de fabricación de polos como telas e hilos. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más su negocio con la compra de nuevas maquinarias textiles y crecer como una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosa C. belongs to the Ebenezer Communal Bank.  It was formed over four and a half years ago, and it is comprised of nine members.  The members are all neighbors who come from the Agustino district.  This group displays the characteristics of success and perseverance as the members manage their businesses.

Rosa C., age 37, is an example of this.  She has two small children under her care.  Every day she makes polo-type shirts.  She does this in her house, where she has set up a small shop.  After she makes them, she sells them to people who have placed previous orders.

She will use the loan to buy materials to make  polo-type shirts.  She will buy things like fabric and thread.

In the future she would like to expand her business by purchasing new textile machinery.  She would also like to grow as a great businesswoman.

loans.use: Buy materials for making polo-type shirts

loans.name: Carmen Odila

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas.
 
La señora Carmen esta en el Banco comunal hace 15 años  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las amigas que ha hecho en todo este tiempo. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer de un camión.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa interior de damas de la marca Leonisa, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Flavio Alfaro a realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito y cobra  semanalmente dice que le encanta vender. Y que no se siente bien sino realiza alguna actividad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa intima, bisutería, cremas y perfumes.  Sus sueños son tener un bazar en su casa ya que el tiempo va pasando y se siente cada dia mas cansada.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of 'Las Orquideas' (The Orchids) community bank meet in the Los Tamarindos neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi.  This city has been known for many years as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Carmen has been a member of this community bank for 15 years.  She likes the bank for the additional benefits that its members receive from the institution and because of the friends that she has made during her time as a member.  Carmen is 57 years old, married and has 5 children who are all now grown up and living independently.  Her husband is a truck driver.

Carmen sells products from catalogs.  She sells Avon, Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She also sells Leonisa-brand ladies' underwear.  She works every day from 8.30am to 5.00pm.  She makes her sales door to door and she travels to the town of Flavio Alfaro to make her sales.  She leaves her goods on credit and collects payment for them every week.  She says that she loves to sell and that she doesn't feel happy unless she is carrying out a business activity. 

Carmen will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as underwear, costume jewelry, creams and perfumes.  Her dream is to own her own store in her home as time is passing and she feels more tired every day.

loans.use: To buy underwear, costume jewelry, cream and perfume

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Dorotea, tiene 53 años D. edad, resiD. en Santiago D. María departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y tienda, ella vive con sus dos hijos D. 16 y 6 años D. edad, es V., su negocio surgió por iniciativa propia has 4 años, lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, ropa D. bebe, entre otros productos que son necesarios para los clientes, con este préstamo fortalecerá el negocio y mantendrá un buen nivel D. inventario.
Sus aspiraciones con respecto al negocio son crecer y atender bien a su clientela, con su familia su propósito es velar por el bienestar D. sus hijos para que no les falte nada ya que dependen únicamente D. ella.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 53 years old.  She lives in Santiago D. Maria, in Usulutan department.

Dorotea's business is selling clothes.  She is a widow and lives with her two children aged 16 and 6.  She started her business on her own initiative four years ago.  It is located in the town market and she works there from 6.00am to 5.00pm.

Dorotea is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, skirts, underwear, baby clothes and other products that her customers need.  This loan will help her to strengthen her business and keep a good level of inventory.  Her aspirations with respect to her business are to grow and to serve her customers well.  As regards her family, her goal is to look out for the well-being of her children so that they don't want for anything since they depend on her alone.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Katty Belin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas.
 
La señora Katty está en el Banco comunal hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otros Bancos. Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y una niña de 4 años, el mayor esta en colegio y la niña en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo el mismo que tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz, ella le ayuda ya que en el taller también se venden repuestos, aceites, y otros artefactos de carros, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, en su trabajo le ayudan tres operarios a quienes se les paga un sueldo semanal.
 
Este crédito es para  comprar un scanner para revisar la parte computarizada de los automóviles. Sus metas son que el trabajo nunca falte y que el taller crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Las Orquideas' (The Orchids) community bank meet in the Los Tamarindos neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi.  This city has been known for many years as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Katty has been a member of this community bank for 8 years and she likes it because the interest rates are very low compared to other banks.  Katty is 38 years old, married and has two children aged 12 and 4.  Her eldest is in high school and her young daughter is in pre-school.  Her husband is a car mechanic.

Katty is a very good housewife who, in order to help her husband with their household expenses, takes loans for her husband's business.  Her husband owns a car repair shop.  She helps him since he also sells spare parts, oil and other car accessories in his shop.  Katty works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  They have three workers who help them in their work and they pay these workers a weekly salary.

This loan will be used to buy a scanner to service the computerized parts of the cars her husband works on.  Her goals are to never lack work and for the garage to keep growing every day.

loans.use: To buy a scanner

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in Beirut.  Jihad has been a car mechanic for 23 years.  He opened his own garage in 1996. Jihad is requesting his second loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for his children's school fees. His previous loan was for his business, and it was very effective. He is a good standing client, who made the best with his previous loan. Jihad seeks the best for his children, and education is the most important aim for him now. Jihad hopes to open a bigger garage in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She has owned a grocery store since 2000. Sonia is requesting her first loan from Al Majmoua  in order to add new products to her business. Sonia is a honest, hard worker and loved by most of her clients and friends. Sonia’s dream is to open a supermarket in the future. Her clients are most of her friends, relatives, neighbors, and passers-by.

loans.use: To add new products

loans.name: Camino Al Éxito Group

texts.es: Bonifacia A. es integrante D. la alcancía comunal Caminando al Éxito con formado por  nueve socias,  todas ellas vecinas ya que viven en el mismo barrio, ellas radican en el distrito D. Agustino. Un grupo D. mujeres optimistas para los negocios y muy empeñosas en salir adelante.  Muestra D. ello es la señora Bonifacia A. D. 43 años D. edad es madre soltera D. un pequeño niño que es su adoración y su motivo principal por salir adelante. Ella desD. muy temprano se dedica a la fabricación D. billuteria que es la realización D. artículos artesanales como pulseras y collares  entre otras cosas, este trabajo le ha generado ingresos modestos y gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante junto a su hijo y comenzó en este negocio por que no le generaba ganancias  la comida que vendía anteriormente. En el futuro le gustaría  poder tener un bazar. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. artículos que utiliza para la fabricación D. pulseras.
texts.en:
Bonifacia A. is a member of the "Camino al Éxito" ["Path to Success"] communal bank, which has nine members who all live in the same neighborhood in the district of Agustino.  They are an optimistic group of women when it comes to their businesses and they are earnest in their efforts to get ahead.

One example is Bonifacia A..  She is 43 years old and the single mother of a small boy who she adores; he is the primary motivation for all her efforts.  Starting very early in the morning, she makes artisanal jewelery like bracelets and necklaces, among other pieces.  This work has generated a modest income and thanks to this, she and her son have been able to keep moving forward together.  She started in this business because the food she was selling before this wasn't generating profits.  In the future, she would like to have a variety store.  With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of materials to make bracelets.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bracelets

loans.name: Eulalia Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas.
 
La señora Eulalia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones aprende mucho, le gustan las charlas de salud. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, el menor esta en colegio y vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja esta delicado de salud.

Tiene un soda bar en el cual además de vender bebidas como colas y batidos también vende comidas rápidas como hamburguesa, hot dog entre otras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 18h00 hasta las 22h00, esta labor la realiza sola. Las bebidas que ella vende y que son fabricadas las recibe en su local, nos cuenta que lleva ya buen tiempo con su negocio y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar, sodas, aguas y otros productos para preparar los alimentos. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: The members of the Las Orquídeas ["The Orchids"] communal bank meet every 15 days in the housing community of Los Tamarindos, which in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí and has been known for many years as the city of los reales tamarindos ["the royal tamarinds"]. Ms. Eulalia is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she learns a lot at the meetings. She particularly likes the talks about health. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage. Two of her children are already grown and independent, while the youngest is in secondary school and lives with her. Her husband does not work because his health is delicate. Eulalia has a soda bar where she sells drinks like colas and smoothies as well as fast food like hamburgers, hot dogs, and other items. She works every day from 6:00 PM until 10:00 PM. She does this work alone. The drinks she sells and makes are consumed at her establishment. She tells us that she has been running this business for a good amount of time and that it has gone very well. This loan will be used to buy sodas, fresh juices, and other ingredients for preparing the food. Her goals are to continue working and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fresh juices, and ingredients for preparing food dishes

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en: Khadijeh is 41 years old and married.  She has owned a clothing shop since 2009 and has 12 years of  experience. She is requesting her second loan from Al Majmoua in order to add men's clothing to her business.  Khadijeh is a brave woman who has worked hard to reach her levE. in the market. Khadijeh’s clients come from nearby villages as well as her relatives and friends. Her experience with Al Majmoua helped her expand her business and taught her how to manage her business. Khadijeh is hoping to open another branch in the future with a third loan.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothes

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Doña Salvadora de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo don Pedro en Lolotiquillo departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de pescado y pollo, este negocio en ambulante ella sale a ofrecer los productos por las principales calles de Lolotiquillo, en busca de clientes, este es el ingreso que por su parte recibe y es el que alivia sus necesidades.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pescado fresco y pollo, esta inversión la hará con el objetivo de mantenerse en el negocio, de continuar proveyendo ingresos, ya que estará apoyando a su esposo para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
Sueña con mantener un negocio estable sin la necesidad de caminar por tanto tiempo para poder hacer sus ventas y también a través de las ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Salvadora, 47, lives with her husband Pedro in Lolotiquillo, which is in the department of Morazán.  She is an itinerant vendor of fish and chicken.  She offers her products for sale along the main streets of Lolotiquillo, where she looks for customers.  This is how she earns income to help cover their needs.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy fresh fish and chicken.  She will make this investment with the aim of keeping her business going so that she can continue earning for her family.  She will be supporting her husband to cover their household necessities.

Salvadora dreams of maintaining a stable business without having to spend so much time walking to make her sales.  She also dreams of earning enough to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken to sell

loans.name: Andrea Paola

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas.
 
Aquí conversamos con la señora Andrea, tiene 24 años de edad,  está casada  y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Su esposo es Ing. Civil. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya dos años y  le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de cumplir así como también las reuniones porque en ellas se divierte mucho.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días a cualquier hora ya que sus clientes llegan hasta su casa y no le incomoda atenderlos. En la actualidad esta adecuando un local en el centro de la ciudad donde en estos días espera abrir su local y aprovechar esta temporada que las personas compran bastante mercadería. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Quito donde le llega ropa desde Colombia.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer y de niños que es lo que más se vende. Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener su propio local.
texts.en:
The members of Las Orquídeas [The Orchids] Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the Tamarindos residential community in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí Province, known for many years as the the Tamarind City. 

Here, we spoke with Andrea, who is 24 years old, married and has a 4 year old son. Her husband is a Civil Engineer. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 2 years already, and likes it because it is easy to make her payments and she enjoys the meetings very much. 

She sells all types of clothes from her house where she has a small shop. She tells us that she fills orders for her customers. She works every day; her customers can come to her house anytime, and it never bothers her to serve them. Currently she is remodeling a location in the center of the city where she hopes to open soon and take advantage of this season when people buy a lot of merchandise. She travels to Quito to buy the clothes she sells, which come from Colombia. 

This loan will help her purchase clothes, especially those for women and children, which is what sells the most. Her dream is to continue to grow her business and have her own shop.

loans.use: Purchase women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Senora Maria G., tiene 30 anos de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, habita en la ciudad de Esteli, ella se dedica a la Venta de Comida (Fritanga).
Ella es originaria de La Trinidad, Esteli; proviene de una familia muy pobre y humilde, pero muy honrada y trabajadora. Su Mama vende tortillas y su Papa es Pastor de una Iglesia y su esposo trabaja en una Panaderia.
Estudio hasta el 6to grado de primaria en Esteli, pero por falta de recursos no pudo seguir estudiando.
A la corta edad de 11 anos, comenzo a trabajar, cuidando a una senora de 70 anos, para poder ayudarse con esos ingresos y poder estudiar. Despues vendia helados y actualmente tiene una Fritanga.
Realizo este credito para compra de productos para su Fritanga y tambien para comprar una regrigerador nuevo, espera obtener mayores ganancias.
Su meta es lograr que sus hijos se prepare y puedan conseguir una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Señora Maria G. is 30 years old, married and has 2 children.  She lives in the city of Estelí where she prepares and sells traditional Nicaraguan food (fritanga).  She is originally from La Trinidad in the department of Estelí and comes from a very poor and humble, but very honest and hard-working family.  Her mother sells tortillas, her father is the pastor of a church and her husband works in a bakery.  She finished the 6th grade in Estelí but because of a lack of rescources she wasn't able to continue studying.  At the tender age of 11 she started working, caring for an elderly woman of 70, to help with the income and to be able to study.  After that she sold ice cream and currently, she has a fritanga.  

She will use this loan to purchase products for her fritanga and also to buy a new refrigerator.  She hopes to increase her earnings.  Her goal is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase products with which to prepare traditional Nicaraguan dishes

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Senora Alicia P., tiene 42 anos de edada, originaria de la Comarca Santa Tereza, empalme El Chaguite, en Esteli.
Ella cuenta que sus inicios fueron muy dificiles, pues comenzo con la venta de helados, luego su hermana adquirio un prestamo y le ayudo a poner poco a poco una pequena pulperia, donde comenzo vendiendo granos basicos.
Luego poco a poco fue surtiendola, con ayuda de su esposo tambien, quien se dedica a la siembra de frijoles en sociedad con otro amigo.
Ella hizo este prestamo para avastecer un poco mejor su negocio, sobretodo en estas epocas de navidad que existe una mayor demanda.
Espera tener mejores ingresos, para mejorar su nivel de vida tambien. Espera pagar este prestamo lo antes posible y hacer otro para ir creciendo.
texts.en: Mrs Alicia P., age 42, was born in the Comarca Santa Tereza , in the El Chaguite region, in Esteli. She says that the beginning was very difficult. She started selling ice cream, and later her sister received a loan and helped her to open a small local store, where she started selling basic grains. She stocked it bit by bit with her husband's help. Her husband sows beans with a friend. Alicia has requested this loan to stock her store a bit better. In this holiday season, there is higher demand. She hopes to obtain better income in order to improve her living conditions as well. She hopes to repay this loan as soon as possible and take out another to keep growing.

loans.use: she will purchase inventory for her corner store

loans.name: Maryuri Eunice

texts.es:
La Senora Maryuri S., es originaria de la Comarca San Luis, en Esteli. Es Casada, no tiene hijos aun, tiene 28 anos de edad, es agricultora, y tambien se desempena como comerciante en una pequena tiendita que posee.
Desde la corta edad de 7 anos, le ayuda a sus padres con los que haceres de la casa, y tambien a su Mama a preparar productos como: Rosquillas, Nacatamales y Cajetas, los cuales preparaban para venderlos y ayudarse un poco con esos ingresos.
Sus padres le ayudaron luego a que ella vendiera ropa, zapatos y comida, y aun asi estaba estudiando; pero se vio obligada a abandonar los estudios por razones de salud.
Ella asegura que ha sido una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora y no piensa darse nunca por vencida; entonces decidio junto a su padre, sembrar cafe, y este ultimo le ha producido buenas ganancias para seguir trabajando.
Realizo este credito para comprar insumos para la siembra de cafe, para mejorar la calidad de su producto.
Dentro de sus proximos proyectos estan poner una tienda y seguir aumentando la produccion de cafe.
texts.en: Mrs Maryuri S. is from the Comarca San Luis in Esteli. She is married and does not yet have children. She is 28, a farmer, and also works as a merchant in a small store that she owns. At the young age of seven years, she started helping her parents with the housework, and also helped her mother to prepare products such as: rosquillas [a type of donut], nactamales and cajetas. They prepared these foods to sell and make a bit of an income. Her parents later helped her to sell clothing, shoes and food, even though she was studying. However, she had to abandon her studies for health reasons. She says that she has always been a hard-working person who never gives up, so she decided to work with her father, sowing coffee. This has provided her with good earnings to keep working. She is taking out this loan to purchase tools for sowing coffee, to improve the quality of her product. Part of her next products will be to open a store and keep increasing her coffee production.

loans.use: sowing coffee

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El Senor Jose C., tiene 35 anos de edad, originario de La Concordia, Esteli, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a la siembra de Tomates; con mas de 15 anos de experiencia en el sector agricola.
Desde los 8 anos de edad ayuda a sus padres con las actividades agropecuarias, el se dedicaba a cuidar a los bueyes. Sus estudios llegaron hasta el 6to grado de secundaria, debido a la falta de recursos, pues sus padres no podian a veces ni facilitarle el pasaje para que pudiera ir a estudiar al Coyolito, que era la escuela mas cercana que tenia.
Se caso a la edad de 20 anos, por lo que de ahi en adelante se independizo, pero viviendo siempre con sus padres; con sus primeros ingresos, logro ir recogiendo dinero y poco a poco fue haciendo su casita.
Realizo este prestamo para la compra de insumos para sembrar Tomates, espera obtener buenas ganancias de esta produccion.
El desea que sus hijos se preparen y que tengan un mejor nivel de vida, es un sacrificio que el esta haciendo, para ofrecerles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Mr Jose C., age 35, is from La Concordia, Esteli. He is married, has 4 children, and sows tomatoes. He has over 15 years of experience in agriculture. At the age of eight he started helping his parents with agricultural work; he took care of the oxen. He studied until the sixth grade of secondary school, because of his family's lack of resources. His parents could not always fund his ticket to study in Coyolito, which was the closest school. He got married at the age of 20, and from then on was independent, but still living with his parents. With his first earnings, he was able to save money and he has been building his house bit by bit. He has taken out this loan for the purchase of tools to sow tomatoes. He hopes to make a good income from this harvest. He wants his children to be educated and to have a better quality of life. He is making a sacrifice to offer them a better future.

loans.use: the sowing of tomatoes

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
El Senor Leopoldo H., tiene 58 anos de edad, casado, con 7 hijos, agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, fue alfabetizado; habita en El Coyolito, La Concordia, Esteli.
El cuenta que tuvo una ninez muy sufrida, no disfruto, pues desde la corta edad de 7 anos empezo a trabajar, criando animales, en ocasiones tenia que caminar mas de 1 hora para llevarlos a tomar agua, porque no habia rios cerca; esta situacion le impidio estudiar, ademas la escuela mas cercana le quedaba a 2 horas de su casa.
A partir de los 12 anos comenzo a sembrar, para poder ayudar a sus padres y poder costear sus propios gastos, pero de esta manera inicio su experencia en este sector.
A los 23 anos se caso, lo que le dificulto mas sus problemas economicos, porque comenzo a tener hijos; 
El realizo estee prestamo para comprar insumos para la siembra de Tomates, espera obtener buenas ganancias; pero ademas de esta actividad, posee otros ingresos por ganado y aves de corral.
Espera que de sus 7 hijos se puedan prepara la mayoria para que ellos puedan tener un mejor futuro y no sufrir tanto como el.
texts.en: Mr Leopoldo H., age 58, is married with seven children. He is a farmer who plants vegetables. He has been educated. He lives in El Coyolito, La Concordia, Esteli. He says that he had a very difficult childhood, and from the young age of seven he started to work, raising animals. At times he had to walk more than an hour to bring the animals to water, because there were no rivers nearby. This situation hindered his studies, and furthermore the nearest school was two hours from his house. From the age of twelve he started planting in order to be able to help his parents and cover his own costs. This is how he gained experience in this sector. At the age of 23 he got married, and their greatest difficulty was economic problems, because they started having children. He is requesting this loan to purchase items for sowing tomatoes. He hopes to make a better income. On top of this business, he has other income from livestock and barnyard birds. He hopes that his seven children will be able to be better prepared so that they can have a better future and not suffer as much as he has.

loans.use: planting vegetables

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es:
El Senor Oscar Z., tiene 50 anos de Edad, casado, con 3 hijos, habita en la Comarca Mata Palo, en Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli; se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de hortalizas. Tiene mas de 20 anos de experiencia en este tipo de actividad.
Sus inicios fueron dificiles, empezo con la siembra de granos basicos, como frijoles, maiz, y hortalizas etc. inicio con fondos propios y ayuda de su familia. Su esposa le ayuda un poco tambien, pues ella se dedica a la venta de pan hornado y cosa de horno.
El solicito este credito para la siembra de hortalizas y compra de insumos basicos para realizar esta produccion.
Espera obtener buenos resultados de esta cosecha y mejorar poco a poco su nivel de vida.
Su meta es poder expandir sus negocios y comprar mas tierra para producir mas, con la ayuda de su familia.
texts.en: Mr Oscar Z., age 50, is married with three children. He lives in the Comarca Mata Palo, in Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. He is a farmer who sows vegetables. He has over 20 years of experience in this work. The beginning was very difficult. He started sowing basic grains, such as beans, corn and vegetables, etc. He started with his own funds and the help of his family. His wife helps him a little as well. She sells bread and other baked items. Oscar is requesting this loan for the sowing of vegetables and the purchase of basic items for production. He hopes to have good results from this harvest and improve his living conditions little by little. His goal is to be able to expand his businesses and buy more land to produce more, with the help of his family.

loans.use: sowing vegetables

loans.name: 23 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “23 de Julio” iniciará el ciclo número nueve en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: Kiosco de dulces, venta de refrescos, comercio y reparto de víveres, venta de dulces y refrescos, venta de ganado, venta de productos AVON, elaboración de Cotillón, bordados.

En el caso de la señora  Fanny, presidenta de la banca comunal, ella tiene como negocio  la venta de cotillón,  hace seis años aprendió de su cuñada y desde ese entonces ella viaja a la población de Desaguadero para traer mercadería y la vende en la ciudad de La Paz, en un lugar comercial llamado “La Tablada”, vende todos los días desde las diez de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche.  Este lugar de venta es muy concurrido por la población porque se conoce que es muy económico.  La señora Fanny cuenta con el apoyo de su cuñado, que le reemplaza en la atención del puesto cuando es necesario.
La señora Fanny es una persona emprendedora, a sus veintinueve años, además de contar con este negocio es esposa y madre de tres niños.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde “el crédito”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “23 de Julio” (23rd of July) will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada.  The group consists of eight members and is directed by an executive council made up of the president, treasurer, and secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied: candy stand, selling refreshments, selling and repairing homes, selling candy and beverages, selling cattle, selling AVON products, making party supplies, embroidery.

In the case of Fanny, president of the Communal Bank, she has as a business selling party supplies. 6 years ago she learned this business from her brother-in-law and since then she travels to Desaguadero to bring merchandise and sells it in the city of La Paz, in a commercial location called “La Tablada.” She sells every day from ten in the morning until eight at night. This location is highly frequented by shoppers as it is known as being inexpensive. Fanny counts on her brother-in-law’s support, as he helps her sell when she needs it.

Fanny is a very entrepreneurial person at her 29 years of age, in addition to her business she is a wife and mother of three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds, “the loan.”

loans.use: Buy party supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Sao Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. group of twenty people lives I. Snuol Khpos village, Takeo province. Mrs. Touch S. L. is the group's president, selected by the other members all of whom will use their portion of the loA. for a different purpose to improve their famiL.'s standard of living. 

Mrs. Touch S. L. is a weaver at her home and able to earn some money, while her husband, Mr. Phanna Buon, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice and sell to support his famiL.. Now her business is going well, so she wants to expand. For this purpose, she is seeking a loA. to buy more silk. She is a mother of two children who are students I. the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
La Senora Martha M., tiene 45 anos, madre soltera de 4 hijos, se dedica a la Ganaderia, habita en la comarca El Guapinol, Esteli.
Ella inicio con la siembra de frijoles y de lo que obtuvo de ganancia, invirtio para crianza de ganado y con la comercializacion de granos basicos, recogio un poco de dinero para poder comprar mas ganado.
Sus actividades han sido muy diversificadas, pues a tenido crianza de cerdos, de aves y siembra de frijoles, ella ha tratado de hacer un poco de todo aprovechando las tierritas que le heredaron sus padres.
Sus hijas obtienen un poco de ayuda para sus gastos, con los ingresos obtenidos de lo que producen las vacas, tales como leche, crema, queso y cuajadas.
Este Credito lo realizo para alimentacion de su ganado, para obtener mejores resultados, y ademas uso un poco de este dinero, para mejorar un poco su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs Martha M., age 45, is a single mother of four children. She raises livestock and lives in El Guapinol, Esteli. She started off sowing beans and invested her earnings in raising livestock and selling basic grains. She saved a bit of money for buying more livestock. Her work has been very diversified; she has raised hogs and birds, and sown beans. She has tried to do a bit of everything and to take advantage of the lands that she inherited from her parents. She helps her daughters a little with their costs from the income from her cows' production; milk, cream, cheese and curds. She will use this loan for food for her livestock, in order to obtain better results. She will also use a bit of this money to improve her home a little.

loans.use: food for livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Nuon Som Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are living in Prasat village, Takeo province, make up this village-bank loan. Mrs. Nuon S. is a village-bank president who has been selected by the other members, all of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their families' lives. 

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which to grow rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bun Toeun Thai, is a driver who gets a low salary to support his family. Although they try to work a lot, they can only earn a little money. So to improve her family, Mrs. Nuon S. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

She has seven children, one of whom is a driver, while two are employed in garment factories, three are students, and one does housework.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El Senor Luis R., tiene 60 anos de edad, casado, con unicamente 1 hijo, habita en la comarca El Rodeo, Esteli, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 30 anos, su educacion es muy elemental, fue alfabetizado.
Inicio en estas actividades desde muy nino, ya que sus padres eran agricultores, se dedicaban a la siembra de cebolla, y el les ayudaba a regar las plantaciones.
Tambien ha tenido experiencia en la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral.
El realizo este credito para la siembra de Maiz, Sorgo y Frijoles; espera obtener buenos resultados de esta producion.
Su meta es ampliara su produccion de granos basicos; le pide a sus hijos que se concentren en sus estudios para que puedan tener un mejor futuro y puedan preparse, ya que el por falta de recursos no pudo hacerlo.
texts.en: Mr Luis R., age 60, is married with one child. He lives in the Comarca El Rodeo, Esteli, and has worked in agriculture for over 30 years. His education is very basic. He is literate. He started this work at a very young age, since his parents were farmers. They planted onions, and he helped them to water their lands. He has also had experience in raising hogs and barnyard animals. He is taking out this loan for planting corn, sorghum and beans; he hopes to have better results from this harvest. His goal is to expand his production of basic grains; he has asked his children to concentrate on their studies so that they can have a better future and be educated; what he could not do for lack of resources.

loans.use: the sowing of corn, sorghum and beans

loans.name: Las Mayas Group

texts.es:
