La B.C. “Las Mayas” (traducido del idioma aymara podriamos decir "las primeras")iniciará el ciclo número cuatro en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: comerciante y venta de comida, comerciante y costura de chompas, venta de calzados, tejidos de chompas, ferretería, comerciante de CD´s, venta de pollos a la Broster, venta de papas fritas, tejido de centros (ropa interior  que usan las señoras por debajo de la pollera, en número de tres o cuatro), venta de comida.

La señorita  Lucia, secretaria de actas de la banca comunal, indica que forma parte de la B.C. “Las Mayas”  cuatro ciclos.  Actualmente soltera, no tiene planificado formar familia por ahora.   Su  negocio es el tejido a máquina y a mano, chompas y mantas.   Comenzó tejiendo chompas hace tres años y hace cuatro meses que teje mantas, habilidades que aprendió de su hermana.

Las ventas son realizadas de manera ambulante en la zona 16 de julio, en las ferias de los días jueves y domingo.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta hablar, reir y compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en: The “Las Mayas” group (translated from the Aymara language, "the first ones") is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana office. It is made up of ten members. The community bank is directed by a board made up of a president, treasurer and a secretary. The members' businesses are varied: food sales, sewing sweaters, selling shoes, knitting sweaters, hardware, selling CD's, selling Broster chicken, selling french fries, knitting centros (underwear that women wear under skirts), and food sales. Lucia, the community bank secretary, says that she has been a member of the Las Mayas community bank for four cycles. She is currently single and does not currently have any plans to start a family. Her business is weaving sweaters and blankets by hand and with a machine. She started weaving sweaters three years ago and she has been weaving blankets for four months. She learned these skills from her sister. She makes these sales on the street in the 16 de Julio zone, in the Thursday and Sunday markets. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes talking, laughing and sharing with her friends.

loans.use: the purchase of wool

loans.name: Mrs. Bun Sokhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village-bank loan consists of 14 people who are living in Prasat village in the Takeo province. Mrs. B. S. is a village-bank president who has been selected by the other members, all of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their families' living conditions. 

She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also sells brooms at the local market. Since both businesses are going well, she wants to expand. So to increase her daily income, Mrs. B. S. is requesting a loan to buy more brooms, and with the rest of the loan, she is going to buy rice seeds. 

She is a widow with two children. One of her children is a student, but the other does housework.

loans.use: To buy more brooms

loans.name: Sameang

texts.en: Mrs. Sameang S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sokcheat Keun, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2005 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of the children are in school. Sameang is a weaver. She also invests with her parents in a rice farming business. Her husband is a security guard. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
Mr. San S., age 57, is a laborer and his wife, Mrs. Phon Sophann, is a seamstress in a garment factory. With their careers, they are able to earn some income to support their family. Currently their house does not have a kitchen for cooking. Thus, Mr. San S. would like a loan to add to his savings to buy timbers to build a kitchen to support his wife's cooking. This couple has two children who are working as security guards for a company. 

Eighteen members have formed this village bank, located in Liek village in Kandal province. Mr. San S. is the village bank president having been selected its members. The members of this village will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a kitchen

loans.name: Julia Dalila

texts.es:
La Senora Julia R., tiene 55 anos de edad, casada, con 5 hijos, habita en la Comarca San Antonio en Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. Se dedica a la siembra de Tabaco.
Inicio en ese negocio, porque habia una empresa llamada PROTALASA, del Senor Fidel Olivas, que estaba financiando este tipo de actividad, pero no era para todo el ciclo, sino que para una parte, al menos para que ellos comenzaran.
Sus actividades no solo se encierran en esto, sino que tambien tiene crianza de Aves, ganado y siembra de granos basicos, es decir que su produccion es variada.
Recibe remesas familiares de 2 hijas de los Estados Unidos, que estan indocumentadas en ese pais.
Hizo este credito para compra de insumos para la siembra de Tabaco.
Espera que todo le salga bien, para poder con estas ganancias mejorar su vivienda y ofrecerles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia R. is 55 years old, married and has 5 children.  She lives in San Antonio region, in Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli.  Her business is growing tobacco.

Julia started this business because there was a company called Protalasa, belonging to Mr Fidel Olivas, which was financing this type of activity but not for the whole season, just for a part of it.  At least to get people started.

Julia's business activities are not restricted to this one.  She also raises poultry and other livestock and she grows basic grains.  Her production is varied.

Julia receives family remittances from her two daughters who are in the United States, as illegal immigrants in that country.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for growing tobacco.  She hopes that everything works out well and that she can use these profits to improve her home and offer her children a better standard of living.

loans.use: To sow tobacco

loans.name: Meu

texts.en:
Mr. Meu Kop (pictured with his son) is a widower with two sons – one runs a wedding planning and decoration business and the other attends school. He lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Meu is a fisherman. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase fishing materials for his business, and to buy materials for his son’s wedding planning and decoration business.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishing business & wedding planner business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem Y., 33, is the mother of three children. All her kids are single and still live under her care. She was once married, but has been divorced from her husband for a year. To earn a living, Sem Y. owns a small store at a good location. 

In her shop, she sells different kinds of products such as soft drink, water, fast food, and other items to people from her village and other villages.  One of her children assists her in the business with the buying and selling.

Sem Y. normally earns an average of $8 per day to help cover the family’s daily living expenses. Sem Y. is currently selling well because she has skills in communicating with people. To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a loan which she will use  to accumulate various items, for example fast food, soft drinks, and other products to sell.  With the rest of the funds, she will buy a piece of land in a good location for farming, and will hire it out to earn additional income.

loans.use: To buy products to sell, and buy a piece of land to lease out

loans.name: Mrs. Phouk Sim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people are making up this village bank loan.  They are living in Prey Robang village in Takeo province. Mrs. PhoU. S. has been selected by the other members to be the village bank president.  The members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes  to improve their family living. 

Mrs. PhoU. S. is a silk weaver.  She works from home and is able to earn some money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Choeng, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. On the farm, the rice field has infertile soil and is far away from an  irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. PhoU. S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her husband's rice farm. 

Mrs. PhoU. S. is a mother of three children, two of whom are students, while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Jarin Yariel

texts.es:
El Senor Jarin Z., tiene 26 anos de edad, actualmente soltero, sin hijos, habita en la Comarca El Rodeo, de Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. Se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando Tomates y Maiz.
Esta actividad la ha realizado desde muy pequeno, el indica que mas bien es por tradicion, ya que todos sus antepasados se han dedicado a la agricultura.
El recuerda que desde la edad de 12 anos, se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos basicos y hortalizas; cuando ya estaba un poco mas adolesente, viajo a Costa Rica, fue a trabajar y recogio una cantidad de dinero, la cual vino a invertr a su pais.
Para diversificar un poco sus actividades tambien se dedica un poco a la ganaderia.
Realizo este credito para la siembra de Tomate y Maiz, y la compra de insumos agricolas.
Dentro de sus metas esta crecer con la siembra de estos productos y comprar maquinaria mas capacitada para producir mejor.
texts.en: Mr Jarin Z., age 26, is currently single and has no children. He lives in the Comarca El Rodeo, Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. he works in agriculture, sowing tomatoes and corn. He has done this work from a very young age. He says that this is tradition, and that all of his ancestors have worked in agriculture. He remembers that from the age of 12 he has sown basic grains and vegetables; when he was a little older, he traveled to Costa Rica to work and made some money, which he invested in his country. In order to diversify his activities a little he has also worked in livestock. He is taking out this loan to sow tomatoes and corn, and to purchase agricultural tools. Part of his goals is to expand his sowing and purchase better machinery for better production.

loans.use: the sowing of tomatoes and corn

loans.name: Mrs. Mut Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people from Prey Robang village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan.  The members have selected Mrs. Mut N. as the village bank president.  The members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Mut N. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Roeung Seng, is a door-to-door toy seller.  With this business, he is able to earn some money to support his family. 

Mrs. Mut N. is having problems with her farm because her field has infertile soil and a lot of insects.  To improve production, Mrs. Mut N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.  With the remainder of the funds, she will buy more toys for her husband to sell.  

This couple supports five children, one is a laborer and  the others are students at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & pesticides, and buy toys to resell

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeng S. (in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Kong Dam, have been married since 1995. They live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yeng has been a weaver for more than 10 years. Her husband is a fisherman.  To earn extra income, he also operates a motor taxi service in his village when he is free. 

Yeng had  requested and repaid 2 previous Kiva loans.  She is now requesting her third loan in the amount of $200 to purchase rice for food.

loans.use: To purchase rice for food

loans.name: Carlos Ariel

texts.es:
El Senor Carlos A., tiene 27 anos de edad, casado, actualmente no tiene hijos, habita en la comarca Mata Palos, Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. Se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando Tomate.
Empezo a trabajar a la edad de 16 anos, sus padres poseen una pequena parsela, y su hermano mayor fue quien le enseno estas actividades.
Por un tiempo emigro al pais vecino de Costa Rica, donde recogio algo de dinero y regreso a invertirlo en la siembra de hortalizas.
Tambien posee otras habilidades como es el area de la Zapateria, por un tiempo se dedico a la elaboracion y reparacion de zapatos. Tambien se ha dedicado a la compra venta de hortalizas, como Papa, Repollo, Chiltoma, etc.
Realizo este credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para la siembra de Tomates.
Con lo que obtenga de ganancias, espera mejorar su produccion de tomate para la proxima cosecha.
Dentro de sus metas esta instalar un taller de Zapateria para ayudarse con estos otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos A. is 27 years old, married and currently has no children.  He lives in Mata Palos region, in Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli.  He is a farmer and grows tomatoes.

Carlos started working at the age of 16.  His parents owned a small plot of land and his older brother taught him the business.  For a time, he emigrated to the neighboring country of Costa Rica where he made a bit of money and then returned home to invest it in growing vegetables.

Carlos also has skills in the shoe-making business.  For a time, he worked making and repairing shoes.  He has also worked buying and selling vegetables such as potatoes, cabbages, sweet peppers, etc.

Carlos is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies for his tomato crops.  He hopes to use his profits to improve his tomato production for his next harvest.  One of his goals is to set up a shoe-maker's workshop to make more income.

loans.use: To grow tomatoes

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yuon H. (in the photo) is 50 years old. Her husband, Mr. Ko San, is 52 years old. They have been married since 1986 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One is a garment-factory worker, another one is a construction worker and the other two are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Yuon sells steamed potatoes in Prek Pnao market. Her husband assists his wife in the business. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to connect with her motorbike to carry steamed potatoes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect with her motorbike to carry steamed potatoes for sale

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en:
In Liek village in Kandal province, there are 15 members who form a village-bank loan. This village selected Mrs. Pum A., a 39-year-old married woman, as the village-bank president. The members of this village hope that they will increase their incomes to improve their families' living conditions with the use of this loan.

Mrs. Pum A. is a farmer who owns a piece of land in which she cultivates rice for a living. In order to support her family, she would like to ask for a loan to buy rice for eating. Her husband, Mr. Pech Bros, 40 years old, works as a construction worker and is able to earn only a little salary to support his family. 

This couple works very hard to support their three children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice for eating

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Mrs. Von Y. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Koy Oul, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, one attends school, one is a construction worker and another one has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a wooden-house repairman and a fisherman. 

Vun was a weaver, but she stopped the business. Their main source of income is from her husband and her child’s salary. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work

loans.name: 23 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “23 de Septiembre” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva compuesta por una presidenta, una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: costura de pantalones, lavandería, costura de buzos y deportivos, tejido de mantas, venta de ropa de segunda mano.

En el caso de la señora  Wendy, presidenta de la banca comunal, ella tiene como negocio  la costura de pantalones y ropa en general,  hace cuatro meses que lleva adelante este negocio, aprendió costura en la ciudad de Cochabamba tomando un curso de Corte y Confección, por ahora hace costura a pedido.   La señora Wendy espera comprar una máquina de costura recta que le permita aumentar su producción.

La señora Wendy es una mujer joven, a sus veintidos años, además de contar con este negocio comparte con su pareja el cuidado de sus dos hijos, en Pro Mujer es la presidenta.
texts.en: The “23 de Septiembre” lending group is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Office. It has eight members, and the community bank is directed by a board of a president, treasurer and a secretary. The members' businesses are varied: sewing pants, laundry, sewing sweatsuits and sports clothing, weaving blankets, and selling second-hand clothing. Mrs. Wendy, the community bank president, has a business in which she sows pants and clothing in general. She has had this business for four months. She learned sewing in the city of Cochabamba, taking a dressmaking course. She currently makes clothing on order. Mrs Wendy hopes to purchase a straight sewing machine that will allow her to increase her production. Mrs Wendy is a young women, age 22. On top of this business, she shares the care of her two children with her partner. She is the president of Pro Mujer.

loans.use: the purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., 27 years old, and her husband, Mr. Viseth An, 31 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2002 and have two children - one son and one daughter. The daughter is in school and the son is still young. 

Sopheap and Viseth are farmers. They also operate a weaving business when they are not farming. Sopheap is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ven's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven T., 49 years old, was selected as the village bank president by the 15 people forming this group loan in Liek village in Kandal province. All members of this village group loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Ven T. earns her living by tailoring at home, earning a small income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it and decided to ask for a loan to buy more fabric. Her husband, Mr. Sam Phorn, 55 years old, is a famer who owns 1 hectare of land where he cultivates rice for a living. This couple has three children: one is a police officer and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to expand her business

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun K., 31 years old, and her husband, Mr. Pehn Chanrith Oem, 35 years old, live in a small village on National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1998 and have three children; two are in school and the third is still young.  

Mrs. Savun K. is a rice farmer. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work

loans.name: Mrs. Bin Sokunthear Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people in Ta Phem village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan.  They have selected Mrs. Bin S. to be the village bank president. The members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living.  

Mrs. Bin S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Ven Sin, is a community clerk and construction worker who gets a low salary to support his family.  Mrs Bin S. wants to breed a cow, but her savings is not enough. To achieve this purpose, she needs a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

Mrs. Bin S. is a mother of two children,  who are all students in the local public school. Mrs. Phy Phun is a guarantor, so she is present in this picture. All the members are shown in the picture, although one member is blocked from view.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San P., 31, is married and lives with her husband in Kompong Tom Province. She is a farmer who works for less than $2 each day.  Her husband is a construction foreman. On average, he makes $2 a day. This couple has four children, who still live at home. 

The rice harvesting season is beginning and San P. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them later when the rice commands the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell later

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
The woman in this picture is Im S..  She is 54 years old and lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She owns a small store in her village which is busy with people coming in and out.  She uses this store to sell food in the evening. 

With her food business, she generates a profit of approximately US$1.30 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses. Her husband is the chief provider for the family – he works as a local farmer. This couple has two teenage children. 

Im S. will be using part of this loan money to purchase more ingredients to cook food to sell.  The rest of the loan will be used to help her husband with his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food to sell, and to farm

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San M. (in the photo with her loom) and her husband have been married since 2004.  They have two children  – one son and one daughter, both are still young. 

San is a weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She had previously requested and repaid several Kiva loans.  She is now asking for another in the amount of $200 to buy weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Lav Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people in Ta Phem village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their families.  Mrs. Koem L. has been selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Koem L. and her husband, Mr. Muon Moeun, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family.  He is also  a construction worker.  At the present, Mrs. Loem L. wants to start a new business breeding pigs, but she does not have enough money to support this venture.  To achieve her purpose, she is asking for a loan to buy some piglets and pig food to start this new business. 

Mrs. Koem L. has one child who is just 9 months old.  Mr. Nim C. is a guarantor, so he is present in the picture. All the members are shown in the picture, although four are blocked from view.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Chok's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people living in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province are forming this village bank loan. The members of this village loan selected Mr. Chok O. as the village bank president.  The members will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mr. Chok O. is 39 years old.   He is a single man who works very hard on his farm to make a living. He is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land which he uses to cultivate rice and vegetables.  

He does not have enough money to operate this farm, so  he decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers to plow his farm and grow the crops.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Soeur's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people from Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province are forming this village bank loan.  The members of this village loan selected Mr. Soeur N., 44 years old, as the village bank president. The members will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Soeur N. and his wife, Mrs. Touch P., are famers who own a 2-hectares plot of land which they use to cultivate rice to sell.  They do not have enough money to grow crops on this farm, so Mr. Soeur N. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and gasoline to cultivate rice. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Soeur N. earns additional income by repairing bicycles in the local village. This couple has five children: one of whom stays at home, and the others are students who also help their parents in farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and gasoline to cultivate rice

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
The woman in this photo is Lot R..  She is 37 years old and lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living by raising pigs. 

She has run this business since 2000, and it has provided her with income to support her family. She is married and has three children who are students in the public school. Her husband helps her in raising the pigs.  He also sells firewood for income.  To earn more income, Lot R. will use the loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok H. is 39 years old.  His wife, Mrs. La Nat, is 31 years old.  They are pictured here with their young daughter.  They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They have been married since 1994 and have three children – two sons and one daughter, one is in school and other two are still young. 

Sok is a rice farmer and a fisherman. His wife is a weaver. He is applying for a loan of $100 to help him farm rice.

loans.use: To use for rice farming

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who are located in Samraong K'aer village in Kandal province. They selected Mrs. Chamroen S., a 31-year-old married woman, as the group leader. With the loans, the members hope to increase their income to improve their families' standards of living.

Mrs. Chamroen S. earns her living with her coffee shop business. She only has a small shop and a small space for selling coffee. She is now requesting a loan to buy wood to build a bigger coffee shop in order to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Voeun Vuthy, 31 years old, works as laborer in a garment factory. With both of their jobs, they are able to earn some income to support their two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: to build a bigger coffee shop

loans.name: Mrs. Nou Savet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 16 members of this village bank loan in Dak Por village in Takeo province have selected Mrs. Nou S. as village bank president. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standards of living.

Mrs. Nou S. weaves silk at her home in order to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phorll YoE., is a construction worker and farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. Mrs. Nou S. has a problE. because her roof is broken, but she doesn't have enough money to rebuild it. To improve this situation, Mrs. Nou S. is seeking a loan to rebuild her roof. She is the mother of three children; oN. is a silk weaver while the others are public school students.

loans.use: to rebuild her roof

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Mr. Pho P. and his wife, Mrs. Navy Touch, have been married since 1990 and have five children, all of whom are in school. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Pho sells recycling materials; he also supplements this with a new tuk-tuk (auto rickshaw) business. His wife is now a garment factory worker. He hopes to support his children's further education and have a good job when they finish their studies. Pho is asking for his second loan of $200 to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Sersmaa

texts.en:
Sersmaa D. is 53 years old and is a mother of 3 children.  Sersmaa lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on her sister’s fenced lot in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital of Mongolia.  Her husband passed away 3 years ago. Her two older daughters had finished niversity and are now working, her younger daughter is still a student. 

Sersmaa was a teacher in her town.  After retirement, she started her meat trading business. She began this business in 2006, and works from a rented stall in the local market. After several years of operation, Sersmaa has her own customers. She is a clever and smart woman. 

Sersmaa is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 MNT to buy electricity for her home.

loans.use: To buy electricity for home

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: Five people are forming a group loan. They are located in Chrolong village, Kandal province. This group loan selected Mr. Son S. who is 31 years old as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their money to increase their income to improve the family's living conditions. Mr. Son S. is a farmer who owns a 1.60-hectare plot of land, which he uses to cultivate different vegetables and rice for a living.  He doesn’t have a water machine to pump water to plant his crops. So he decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine for cultivating vegetables and rice. His wife, Mrs. Min Rattana, 29 years old, works as a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary to support her family. This couple has three children. Two of the children attend the local school and one is five years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine (pump) for cultivating vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en:
Thlang S., 45, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs behind her home. She is married to Hun Hoerng, age 44, who helps her in the farming business. This couple has seven children, five of whom are single, and two are married and live in their own house.  

Presently, the weather is dry and it may affect Thlang S.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop. Thlang S. is taking out her loan to purchase a machine that she uses to pump water for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that she uses to pump water for her crops.

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en:
Altantuul M., 39 years old, lives with her two children in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and enclosure. Her youngest daughter attends a local high school.

Altantuul operates a shoemaking business at home and sells at wholesale prices in the “Narantuul”, a market in Ulaanbaatar. Altantuul sews traditional Mongolian shoes according to her customers' orders. She started her business in 2003 and has since gained much experience as a shoemaker. Altantuul is a hardworking person and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mrs. Sarin Lao (pictured above) is 52 years old and her husband, Mr. Srun Kuch is 48 years old. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15  kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1981 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, two attend school and one was hired to sell clothes. Sarin is a weaver. Her husband is an electrician. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 15 members who are living in Damnak Sangkae village in Kandal province. This village loan selected Mrs. K. C., 52 years old, as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their money for different purposes.  Mrs. K. C. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare rice field that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family.  Currently she needs to harvest her crop, so she would like to ask for a loan to pay for farming laborers to harvest her rice. Her husband, Mr. Chum Sem, 58 years old, owns a truck that transports soil to sell.  He also helps his wife with the farming. This couple has four children who all are students and support their parents businesses.

loans.use: To pay for farming laborers to harvest her rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 kg of dry grapes from the USA

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Yat Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Dak Por village in Takeo province, there are 16 people who make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Sao Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. She is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to grow rice to support her family. She is a silk weaver at her home where she is able to earn some money for selling silk cloth. Since her weaving is going well, she wants to expand. For this reason,  Mrs. Sao Y. is seeking a loan to buy more silk. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a driver who gets a low salary to support the family. The other is a seller at a clothes shop who earns a low salary too.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Sarey

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarey L. is 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Pha, is 52 years old. They have been married since 1983 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. The family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sarey sells vegetables in Phnom Penh City. Her husband is employed fulltime. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Ren Rathy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ren R. is forty years old and a widow with a child who is a student in a local school. She also helps with her mother’s businesses. Ren was selected to be the village’s bank president and head of the twelve-member bank loan in Svay Ming village, Kandal province. Each member of this village will use their money to support their different purposes.

Ren owns a small shop from which she sells soup, noodles and coffee to the local villagers. Since her business is doing so well, Ren is asking for a loan to buy more noodles and coffee to expand her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more noodles and coffee

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn M. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Sophea Sao, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2002 and have two young daughters. 

Mrs. Soeurn M. sells jasmine flowers. She pays money to the farmers first before the harvest season. And every day, she buys bread from Phnom Penh and transports it to sell in her village and in the nearby villages. Her husband assists his wife in the business. 

Soeurn is asking for a loan of $1,200 to organize her house by laying bricks and plastering the ceiling and the wall in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: To lay brick and to plaster the ceiling and the wall of her house

loans.name: Mrs. Nhoem Phal Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people from the village of Dak Por in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Nhoem P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members, each of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their standard of living. She is a silk weaver who can earn some money to support her family by selling silk cloth. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So, for that purpose, Mrs. Nhoem P. is applying for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Vanak Noub, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he grows rice to sell to support his family, and he is also a rock breaker. This couple has three children, one of whom is a student. The others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin C., age 25, is married with one young child. Her husband sells firewood and makes a profit on average of 1.5 USD per day. Hin cultivates rice to sell, and she also feeds a few pigs in the cage behind her house.

This is rice harvesting season, and Hin has always hired an ox cart from her neighbor or other villager to transport her rice sheaves to her house. She would like to have her own ox cart, but she lacks the money to buy one, so Hin is asking for a loan to purchase her own cart.

loans.use: To purchase a new ox cart

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom Y. (pictured above) is 52 years old and her husband, Mr. Sokry Loem, is 55 years old. They live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have two sons. One is a garment factory worker and other one has full-time employment. The couple has been farming since they were married. 

Sarom’s husband also does construction work when he is not at the farm. Sarom is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a cow for plowing her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun M. and Mr. Samoeurn Sum are married and live in Sameakki village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She also sells Khmer cake, while her husband is a horse cart driver. Now she has a problem, because her field has infertile soil. To improve production, Mrs. Soeun M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is going to add the rest of the loan to her savings to buy another horse. She is the mother of five children: one of whom is a laborer while the others are studying in public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan includes nine members living in Run village in Kandal province. The members selected Mrs. Loem S. M., a 33-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. The members of this group hope to increase their income and improve the family living through these loans. 

Mrs. Loem S. M. stays at home, cooking and caring for her family. Her husband, Mr. Bun Vorn, is 46 years old.  He works as a motorbike taxi driver, earning a small income to support his family.

In order to increase their income and improve the family’s conditions, Mrs. Loem S. M. would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.
 
This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factoR. and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Mrs. Samphors S. is a garment factory worker. She is a widow and lives with her father in a suburb about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samphors had requested a previous Kiva loan. She wants to build a fence around of her house to protect against thieves stealing household items. Hence she is asking for her second loan of $1,000 for this project.

loans.use: To build a fence around of her house

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Em S. O. is 41 years old.  He is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by the other members. They are located in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mr. Em S. O. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to grow mango for a living.  To support this farming, he would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. His wife, Mrs. Chhay S. O., is 42 years old.  She earns income by knitting clothes.  

This couple has six children: one is employed in a company while the others are attending the local schoO..

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for mango farm

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee M., 49 years old, is a married women who lives with her husband and two children in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is a driver, and her two sons operate taxis, too.

Since 1995, Tsetsgee began selling meat in the Harhorin local market. Her business is stable and she is currently making 350,000 MNT a month. She continues to make progress and has since gained a lot of experience.

Tsetsgee is a woman of integrity and says, “I’m planning to buy a new car for my son’s business.” She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to buy four cows for their meat as well as to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy four cows for their meat

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Rang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people living in Tuol Sang Kha village in Takeo province.  The group has selected Mrs. Thoeun R. as the village bank president.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Thoeun R. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. It is now time to grow rice, but she does  not have enough money to cultivate her crops.  Mrs. Thoeun R. is asking for a loan to do farming this current year. Her husband, Mr. Ean Nob, is a construction worker and farm laborer. 

This couple supports three children – two are attending public school while the youngest one is three years old.

loans.use: To farm rice

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un S. is a villager in Prasout Thmei village in Takeo province. She is married and has two children, who are both employed in garment factories. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.   Her husband, Mr. Chum Men, is a door-to-door plow seller.  With this business, he is able to earn some money to support his family. 

Mrs. Un S. wants to expand her husband’s business to increase their daily income, but she did not have the money. So Mrs. Un S. is applying for a loan to buy more plows to resell. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more plows to resell

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Selling hair is Phen P.'s current job, which earns his daily income for supporting his family. Phen P. goes around his community purchasing hair from ladies who wish to cut their long hair. He buys it at a reasonable price and sells it to a salon shop in the market for profit. Phen P. uses his old motorbike to travel to other provinces every day. Unfortunately, his existing motor is too old and it often breaks down while driving. For this reason, Phen P. would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorbike to replace his broken one. 

Phen P.’s wife is a local farmer in Kompon Tom province and he has four children. Three children are single and one is married.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike to replace his broken one

loans.name: Mrs. An Sami Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An S. is a mother of four children. One is employed in a garment factory, two are students and the youngest one is six years old. Her husband, Mr. Lorn Kat, is a construction worker. They live in Prasout Thmei village, Takeo province. An is the village bank president, chosen by seventeen people to head a village bank loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their family’s standard of living.

An is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land upon which she grows rice to sell to support her family. The couple works hard, yet they earn only a little money. So to increase her family’s income, An wants to start a new business and is asking for a loan to buy some pig feed and piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy some pig feed and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Khin's Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes 10 members who are located in Chong Kaoh village, Kandal province. The members of this loan selected Mrs. Khin C., 46 years old, as the village bank president. They hope that the loans will increase their income to improve their family living. Mrs. Khin C. and her husband, Mr. Cheng Eang, are farmers who own a 1.50-hectare plot of land that they use to cultivate rice and different vegetables to sell. But they don’t have enough money to grow items on the farm. So, Mrs. Khin C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate rice and vegetables. Aside from farming, they also own a small coffee shop to earn a living. This couple is working hard to support their five children. One of the children is a laborer, one is a coffee shop seller, one is a farmer, one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the youngest one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to cultivate rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kry S., 47 years old, and his wife are farmers who own four hectares of land which they use to cultivate rice, corn and different vegetables to sell to make a living. This couple is working hard on the farm but they still do not have enough money, so Mr. Kry S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline. He is working hard to support his four children who are all students and also help their parents farming. 

This village bank includes ten members from Chong Kaoh village, Kandal province. The members of this village selected Mr. Kry S. as the village bank president. They hope to increase their income to improve their standard of living with these loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating rice, corn and vegetables

loans.name: Chauv

texts.en:
Chauv R. is a woman of 24 years who has a life partner in her husband who works as a butcher in his village, earning about 3.30 USD each day. Chauv and her husband have one lovely child (see photo).

Chauv has a small shop in Chey Moulkol village, Kompong Tom Province. She sells a few products such as beef, pork, cooking ingredients, water and fast food as well as rice. As Chauv’s business is operating successfully, she would like to purchase more items to sell such as water and other necessary products. This is why she is requesting a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited, Kiva’s field partner.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Aitkhon's Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are farmers and cattle breeders with much experience among them. The group thanks the Kiva project for providing them with an opportunity to improve their business. They believe it will change their professional life and promise to repay the loan according to established deadlines.

Aitkhon P., 58, is the leader of this group. At this moment she is active in farming and cattle breeding.  From the proceeds of her farming, she purchased a dairy cow.  The dairy business had made a big contribution to her family income. Twenty two years ago she invested 8000 soms in this business start-up and it had paid off well. She was able to make major repairs to her house, and arranged an unforgettable wedding ceremony for her daughter. 

Aitkhon gathered this group because she knew that they need financial assistance as much as she does. She would like to spend this loan to purchase additional cattle to broaden her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make tortas

loans.name: Soung's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members and they are located in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. This group loan selected, Mr. Soung T., 50 years old, as the group leader. While each member of this village will use their portions of this village to support their different purpose.  

Mr. Soung T. is a fisherman where he can earn a little income to support the family. With this business, he doesn’t have a fishing boat for supporting his business. So, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat for fishing. His wife, Mr. Phim Doeuk, 50 years old, earns her living through selling Khmer cake seller in the local market. 

This couple has seven children: two of whom are laborers and four are attending the local school while the youngest one is 4 years old and is not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies to make tortillas

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Naranchimeg is 46 years old divorcee, lives with her mother and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in Naranchimeg’s small family house, which situated along the main road close to all amenities. A few years ago she decided two open a small shop using her house's good location and spare room. She started selling a second hand clothes which she buys from wholesalers. The business is doing very well because the area where she lives is occupied with low income people most of whom can not afford to buy a new clothes. The second hand clothes mostly comes from developed countries in a big bundles and it's in good demand between low income people. Her eldest daughter has separate business and sells clothes on the local outdoor market and the youngest one studies in Art College. Mrs.Naranchimeg looks after her mother as well. Her dream is to give a proper education for her younger daughter by expanding her business. At the moment she is requesting a loan to expand her business and to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more inventory and bundle of clothes for sale

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma H. D. G. D. 50 años D. edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, quien resiD. en Lourdes Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ana trabaja muy duro por sostener su propio negocio en el cual comercializa: carteras, ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, y así mismo cosméticos y cremas para el cuerpo. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación en donD. desD. hace 5 años se dedica a este oficio, por lo que cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Ana solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. poder salir adelante, surtiendo sus ventas y D. esta forma contar con más clientes a los cuales pueda brindar un servicio más surtido D. manera que se encuentren satisfechos y siempre dispuestos a comprar en el negocio D. Ana.
texts.en: Ana Vilma H. D. G., 50, is a hardworking woman living in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad Department.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Ana works very hard to keep her own business going, where she sells handbags and clothing for men, women and children, as well as cosmetics and body lotions.  The business has been located in her home for 5 years, and she has regular clients.  Ana is requesting a loan with the great desire to get ahead, supplying her business in order to gain more clients to whom she can proviD. better service, so that they will be satisfied and always ready to shop in Ana's business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and purses for sale

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make pupusas

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is 57 years of age and a married woman. In order to fix the needs of the family, Meas S. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has been experienced in this sector for eight years and is earning approximately $3 per day. To help contribute for family, her husband works as a used-goods buyer and seller. This family was married for years and they have eight children, two of whom are single and six are married. One of her children works as a firewood seller, and he always sells his product in and around his community. Most profit which he can earn, he always share responsibility with Meas S. for using the whole family. Presently, her child wants to expand his selling business by buying additional firewood for sale. Meas S. wishes is to encourage her kid so that she has decided to borrow fund from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy additional firewood for sale.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena C. F. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Puerto el Triunfo en el departamento de Usulután. Ella es madre soltera de una hija de 14 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. María es una persona muy esforzada quien se dedica a atender una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad y así mismo de uso domésticos, entre los cuales están: especias, carne de pollo y de res. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación lo cual es muy bueno para ella debido a que se encuentra en una zona muy populosa en donde no hay otra tienda en los alrededores, por lo que sus ventas diarias son muy aceptables. María con el deseo de ver en mejores condiciones su hogar, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: huevos, carne de res y de pollo, entre otros más los cuales le permitan brindar un mejor servicio y de esta forma contar con más ganancias.
texts.en: María Magdalena C. F., 47, lives in Puerto el Triunfo, Usulután Department.  She is the single mother of a daughter, 14, who is in school.  María is a hard-working person taking care of her shop where she sells household and domestic products such as spices, chicken, and beef.  Her business is located in her home, which works well for her because she is in a populous area with no other shops nearby, making her daily sales quite acceptable.  María, wanting to see her household situation improved, is requesting a loan in order to purchase eggs, beef, and chicken among other things, allowing her to provide better service and providing greater profits.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and beef for sale

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of household products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio N. de 63 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Oratorio de Concepción, en el departamento de Cuscatlán, en donde vive junto a su esposa y una nieta de 19 años de edad, la cual le ayuda con el negocio. Dionisio es un señor muy emprendedor, quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y es el que le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir de una forma estable junto a su familia. Dionisio solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: bebidas, pan, golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, pan, cereales y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de Dionisio es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten sostener a su hogar.
texts.en: Dionisio Neto, aged 63, lives in the municipality of Oratorio de Concepción in the department of Cuscatlán, where he lives with his wife and a granddaughter, aged 19, who helps him in his business. Dionisio is a very enterprising man who runs his own business, in which he sells perishable goods and basic necessities. His store is located at his home and enables him to have a stable life with his family. Dionisio applies for a loan to buy large quantities of products, such as drinks, bread, candy, disinfectants, detergents, cereals and all other products demanded by his customers. Dionisio's greatest wish is to increase his turnover, as this allows him to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy groceries and household products

location.town: municipio de Oratorio de Concepción, departamento

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic products for her store

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix R. N. de 33 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, en el departamento de Cabañas. Él vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a 5 hijos todos menores de edad. Félix se dedica a la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz, los cuales comercializa en su hogar, así mismo posee un molino el cual alquila a diferentes personas. Félix es un padre de familia muy responsable quien se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar un molino más, de esta forma él espera poder atender a más clientes, con lo cual cuente con más ganancias, las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su hogar y sus cinco hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar.
texts.en:
Félix R. N. is 33 years old and lives in Sensuntepeque, in Cabañas department.  He lives together with his wife, who takes care of the household chores, and his 5 dependent children.

Félix's business is in basic grains such as rice, beans and corn which he sells from his home.  He also owns a mill which he rents out to different people.  Félix is a very responsible father who works hard to get ahead in life.  He is requesting this loan to buy another mill.  In this way, he hopes to be able to serve more customers which will make him more profits.  These profits will be very helpful for his household and his 5 children who are studying.

loans.use: To buy a mill to improve his service

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es: Sonia Beatriz G. D. P. D. 23 años D. edad, es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora la cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico, y así mismo junto a su pequeña hija D. 5 años D. edad. Sonia se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo como: perfumes, maquillaje, accesorios para la cocina y otros más, su negocio es bastante estable ya que cuenta con una cantidad bastante granD. D. clientes los cuales mes a mes consumen los productos que ella comercializa D. forma ambulante, haciendo visitas D. casa en casa mostrando los diferentes catálogos. D. esta forma Sonia se gana la vida y es así como le brinda el apoyo necesario a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor variedad D. cosméticos y así mismo diferentes productos para ofrecer a sus clientes a los cuales en su mayoría compran a crédito por lo que Sonia necesita cierta cantidad D. dinero para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Beatriz G. D. P. is 23 years old.  She is a very responsible and hard-working mother.  Sonia lives together with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and her 5 year-old daughter.

Sonia works selling products from catalogs such as: perfumes, make-up, kitchen accessories, etc.  Her business is quite stable since she has quite a large number of customers who consume, every month, the products that she sells.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner, going from house to house, showing customers her different catalogs.  This is how Sonia makes a living and how she supports her husband with their household expenses.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger variety of cosmetics and also different products to offer her customers who mainly buy her products on credit.  The fact that they buy on credit means that Sonia needs a certain amount of money to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and household products

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe A. D. R. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a dos hijas una mayor D. edad la cual trabaja y una D. 18 años quien se dedica a estudiar. Con el deseo D. poder vivir mejor, desD. hace 5 años y medio que Guadalupe inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Guadalupe atienD. el negocio D. lunes a domingo, y a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite estar en su casa y así mismo vender con sus vecinos los cuales la conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo atrás, lo que hace bastante estable su negocio. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad y D. esta manera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe A. D. R. is 60 years old and lives in Soyapango, in San Salvador department, with her two daughters.  One daughter is grown up and works and the other is 18 and studying.

Five and a half years ago, with the desire to live more comfortably, Guadalupe started her own business which is a store selling perishables.  Her store is located in her home.  Guadalupe serves in her business from Monday to Sunday and, in spite of the fact that it is hard work since she must serve customers all day long, it allows her to be at home and also to sell to her neighbors who have known her for a long time.  This makes her business quite stable.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business, buying a larger quantity of essentials so that she can improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, butter and yeast for making bread

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma M. P. de 42 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Tacachico, en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijas. Irma es madre soltera, por lo que debe esforzarse el doble por contar con todo lo necesario para su hogar, ella posee una venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, así mismo comercializa cosméticos, y zapatos. Su venta esta ubicada en su casa de habitación y así mismo sale para realizar ventas ambulantes, de forma que pueda obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias posibles, las cuales son muy necesarias en su hogar. Irma solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar: ropa, zapatos y cosméticos por mayor y de esta forma obtenerlos a precios más bajos, lo cual le deje mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma M. P. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Tacachico, in La Libertad department, together with her three daughters.  Irma is a single mother which means that she must work doubly hard to have everything she needs for her household.

Irma has a business selling men's and women's clothes.  She also sells cosmetics and shoes.  Her sales location is in her home and she also goes out to make sales as an itinerant street vendor so that she can make as much money as possible which she desperately needs for her household.  

Irma is requesting a loan so that she has the money she needs to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics wholesale as this means she can get them at lower prices which makes her more profits.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cosmetics and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stationery items to stock her bookstore

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús A. B. de 60 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y esforzada, la cual desea mucho salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor, ella reside en el municipio de Soyapango, en el departamento de San Salvador, y vive junto a su hija mayor la cual le ayuda con el negocio. Teresa posee una venta de pupusas, el cual es un platillo típico salvadoreño el cual posee una gran demanda, ella las elabora por las mañanas y en la noche. Teresa posee muy buena clientela, ya que tiene muchos años de ganarse la vida de la misma forma por lo que es muy conocida. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, queso, chicharrón y otros más, para poder hacer más pupusas. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús A. B. is 60 years old.  She is a very hard-working and dedicated woman who wishes very much to get ahead and enjoy a better life.  She lives in the town of Soyapango, in San Salvador department, together with her eldest daughter who helps her in her business.

Teresa has a business selling pupusas.  Pupusas are a traditional Salvadoran food which is in high demand.  She makes her pupusas in the mornings and in the evenings.  She has a very good customer base since she has been making a living in this way for many years and she is therefore well known.

Teresa is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can buy all the supplies she needs such as: corn, beans, cheese, fried pork rinds, etc. to make more pupusas.  She is doing all this with the aim of increasing her sales and thereby creating a better life for herself.

loans.use: To buy corn, fried pork rinds, cheese and beans

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria G. D. U. D. 40 años D. edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 17 y 11 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. DesD. hace 10 años que Victoria posee  una panadería, en la que junto a su esposo se dedican a elaborar el pan que posteriormente su compañero D. vida sale a vender D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Soyapango, mismo municipio en el cual resiD.. Victoria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, levadura y otro horno para poder hacer más pan. Tanto para ella como para su esposo contar con la panadería es una gran bendición debido a que es a través D. esta como obtienen el dinero para pagar todos los gastos del hogar y D. su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria G. D. U. is 40 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who lives together with her husband and two children aged 17 and 11 who are studying.

Victoria has owned a bakery for 10 years.  She works there making bread with her husband which he then goes out to sell as an itinerant street trader in the streets of Soyapango, the town where they live.

Victoria is requesting a loan so that she can buy flour, butter, yeast and another oven so that she can make more bread.  Having the bakery is a great blessing for Victoria and her husband since it makes them the money they need to cover all their household and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making bread

loans.name: María

texts.es: María G. D. A. D. 58 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija, junto a quienes resiD. en San Juan Opico, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee su propio negocio en el cual elabora tortillas, esto lo hace D. lunes a domingo, ya que posee muchos clientes a los cuales es necesario atenderlos lo mejor posible. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación en donD. venD. con la mayoría D. sus vecinos y personas D. los alrededores. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima para elaborar las tortillas. Este negocio es muy importante para María ya que le permite crecer como persona, debido a que pueD. contar con su propio trabajo y D. esta misma forma ayudar a su familia a contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo a contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar.
texts.en:
María G. D. A. is 58 years old.  She lives with her husband and a daughter in San Juan Opico, in La Libertad department.

María owns her own business where she makes tortillas.  She works from Monday to Sunday since she has a lot of customers who she must serve as well as she can.  Her business is located in her home and she sells to most of her neighbors and people who live round about.  

María is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of raw materials for making tortillas.  This business is very important for María since it allows her to grow as a person as she has her own work.  It also allows her to help her family enjoy better financial stability and proviD. her household with everything it needs.

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ulaanhad

texts.en:
Ulaanhad L. is a 44-year-old single mother who lives with her two sons in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital of Mongolia. They are living in their own house with a fence. Her oldest son works in Korea and her youngest son is a university student. 

At first, Ulaanhad operated a grocery-products business in her own grocery store from 2006 to 2009. Since August 2009, she has been selling only all kinds of prepared Korean pasta. She has found success with her business in a short period and her income is a 65,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) a day or 380,000 MNT a month. 

Ulaanhad is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to provide heat in her workplace.

loans.use: To provide heat in her workplace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy essentials for her store

loans.name: Delfida Luz

texts.es: Delfida Luz R. V. de 41 años de edad, reside en cantón San Francisco en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a sus 4 hijos. Delfina es una madre de familia muy responsable, la cual trabaja muy duro por darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, es por ello que posee una venta de carteras, ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, y así mismo comercializa zapatos, estos productos los comercializa en su casa y así también los vende de forma ambulante. Delfida solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio comprando mayor cantidad y variedad de ropa y carteras, a través de los cuales cuente con más ganancias. Delfida posee grandes esperanzas de mejorar su negocio y así vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Delfida Luz R. V. is 41 years old.  She lives in San Francisco canton, in Usulután department, together with her 4 children.

Delfida is a very responsible mother who works very hard to provide her children with the best of everything.  For this reason, she owns a business selling purses and men's, women's and children's clothes.  She also sells shoes.  She sells these products in her home and also makes sales as an itinerant street vendor.

Delfida is requesting a loan so that she can have the money she needs to invest in her business, buying a larger quantity and variety of clothes and purses which will make her more profits.  Delfida has great hopes of improving her business and therefore being able to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes and purses to sell

location.town: Cantón San Francisco  departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en: Asha Kabunge, who is in her mid-30s, is married with four children. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a little monthly profit. This will be Asha's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous Motisha loan to increase her food stock. She has successfully paid back her loan. She hopes for a new Motisha loan to increase her capital. Asha's dream is to be able to educate her children. In the picture, Asha is in front, wearing a blue dress.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem H. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent wH. she was young. She is now married and has three school-aged kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. This is the time for doing a dry-season rice field, but Hem H. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So Hem H. is looking for a loan to use toward purchasing fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en: Enkhtur B. is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Currently, they don’t own land and are living on their relatives' land in a ger (traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His eldest daughter attends a university of finance and economics. The other three children go to a local secondary school. His wife, Battsetseg, works along with him as a cashier. Enkhtur has been running a transportation business for many years and has gained much experience. He used his earnings to buy his minivan, which he rented before. Enkhtur is a very hardworking and optimistic person. He is requesting a loan to purchase some furniture.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Paul Macharia

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Olkalou for the last two years. He is 40 years old and married to Esther Njeri. They have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid off his first loan of 33,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy carrot and pea seedlings for planting in the coming season.

In the future, Paul hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy carrot and pea seedlings for planting

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem L. is a 51-year-old married woman and a local villager in the province of Kompong Tom. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different types of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops and they are growing well. She has been in the farming business since 1990. She often gets good results in both dry seasons and rainy seasons. This couple is blessed with five children, three of whom are single, and two are married. Currently, her house is in the process of being built, but it is not complete yet because she lacks some money to buy more wood for ongoing building. That is why Sem L. would like to request a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy wood for building her house.

loans.name: Susan Muthoni

texts.en:
Susan 33 years old and has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last six years.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for the next planting season.  

In the future, Susan hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 43 years old, married and a father of five.  He runs Sam’s designers tailoring shop.  He has been in the business for sixteen years.  He has managed to employ two people in his business.  He also earns extra income from small-scale farming.   Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has managed to change his business by adding more stock using his previous loan.  He has requested another loan of 30,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Grace Nyambura

texts.en:
Grace has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  She is 33 years old and married to Laban Gitau. They have four children.

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by one of Kiva's field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

In the future, Grace hopes to diversify her source of income and start raising dairy cows for commercial purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang R., age 52, is married with two children, both of whom are single and attending school. She is a domestic rice trader who owns a rice hulling machine inside her home. She provides rice milling services to her neighbors. She also buys rice for milling in bulk at a reasonable cost, and sells the finished rice to people for income. Usually, she generates around $6 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family.  Her husband has worked in the farming business since 2005. This rice harvesting season Heang R. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store for selling, and to continue their farming.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store for selling, and to continue farming.

loans.name: Samuel Munene

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  He is 51 years old, married to Naomi Wacuka, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of Kiva's field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for the next planting season. The climatic conditions for this area are very suitable for potatoes, and this is the region that produces a large amount of potatoes, which are in high demand in Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Boniface Kiboi

texts.en:
Boniface, 23 years old, has been practicing farming in Olkalou town for the last three years, and selling his produce to the local market.
