He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of KADET's field staff and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for the next planting season.

In the future, Boniface hopes to enter the transport sector, diversifying his income.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a 34-year-old carpenter. He has been running his business for six years with two employees.  He was previously employed in a furniture workshop before he decided to start his own furniture business.  Faulu Kenya has helped him to save his money and this has helped him to develop his business.  He has requested 30,000 KES to buy timber, plywood, cushions, block boards, nails and bolts.

loans.use: To buy timber, plywood, cushions, block boards, nails and bolts

loans.name: David Karanja

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last two years.  He is 25 years old, married to Grace Wairimu and they have one child. Carrots and potatoes do well in this region and this produce always has a ready market.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy carrot seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, David hopes to practice mixed farming, thereby diversifying his sources of income.

loans.use: To buy carrot seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom province. She also feeds piglets for selling. She is married to Mr. Va Man, age 40, who earns a living by selling firewood around his village. He can make a profit of approximately $4.50 a day for supporting the family’s daily expenses. 

In the past, Chea S. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing her farmland. Now she hopes to buy her own cow, and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy her own cow for plowing.

loans.name: Richard Kanyagia

texts.en:
Richard has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  He is 34 years old, married to Jane Wangui and they have six children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

In the future, Richard hopes to buy another piece of land in order to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Eunice Wangari

texts.en:
Eunice has been practicing farming in Olkalou for the last three  years.  She is 22 years old, married to Charles Mugo and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

In future, Eunice hopes to enlarge her farming business and become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Genipher

texts.en: Genipher is a 45-year-old member of Faulu Kenya under the Tusaidiane group.  She joined the group as a businesswoman who runs a salon.  She was previously employed in a beauty shop before she opened her own business.  She is the mother of three and she works hard to provide for her family.  She hopes to open a wholesale cosmetic shop in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy hair shampoo, hair braids, a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy hair shampoo, hair braids, blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat Y., 50, sells various kinds of items in From Kompong province. She sells soft drink, fast food, shampoo, and candy in her village to earn a living. Yat Y. is married to Eurn, age 55, who has shared the financial responsibilities by working as a farmer for many years ago. They are good parents to their three children who are students at the public school. 

Yat Y. is running her business well because she has skills in communication which she uses with her customers. Currently, Yat Y. wishes to earn more money to increase her capital to purchase more products such as soft drink, fast food, and other essential items for selling. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To purchase more essential items to sell.

loans.name: Andrew Muya

texts.en:
Andrew has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 3 years. He is 28 years old, married to Beatrice Njeri and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He hopes to use the loan amount to rent a piece of land and plant potatoes.

In future, Andrew hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land and plant potatoes.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim S. is a 54-year-old widower and is blessed with seven children; three are single and four are married. Tim S. is a domestic construction foreman, who has employees to help provide his service. Recently, Tim S. has been very busy at his business with clients who need him to build their houses. Tim S. could earn an income average of US$2.8 per day. Tim S. has a son who is working at a private company. His son has to hire a motor taxi when he goes to work. To save the traveling expense, Tim S. is asking from a loan from Kiva for his son to buy a second familymotorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a second motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a desire to educate his children. He is into agricultural production and also has a maize mill. His business plan is to become a commercial farmer in the region. Solomon intends to use the credit facility to buy a milling machine.

loans.use: Buying a milling machine.
